More specifically, some key areas you will be responsible for:
  • Customer led growth: Maximize the growth by optimizing the value for customers (world-class customer experience, influence user experience improvements in the platform, work alongside other teams in order to gather a holistic understanding of the product and collaborate on innovative plans to increase revenue and so on).

  • Customer obsession: Passionate about providing innovative and effective solutions for customers.
  • Effective communicator: Great communication (written and verbal) and relationship building skills.
  • Passionate about Sustainability: Excited about the impact of the product (and team!) we are building.
Remuneration and rewards package:
 
Remuneration will be determined depending on experience, but we offer competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits package to all our team.
 
Our benefits include:
- Equity, we believe our team should all have a stake in the company we're building.
- Free choice of equipment and software, use whatever works best for you
- A supportive culture to help you learn and develop into a better version of yourself, including a learning & development budget and policy.
- Competitive compensation package.
- Private health and dental insurance for you and your partner/family.
- Generous pension contribution.
- Unlimited holiday policy with a guaranteed minimum of 25 days.
- Flexible working, remote-first, with a budget to join a shared working space wherever you live.
- Health & wellness budget, cycle scheme.
- We compensate your carbon footprint

title: Data Engineer - Machine Learning
description:
Company Description

GeoVisual Analytics is changing the way crops are cared for in the US and around the world. Using routine monitoring of fields with drones, in-field scouting, and satellites, we’re applying our NASA-funded ML algorithms to analyze crop maturity, health, and predicted yields, helping farmers to dramatically reduce production uncertainties and increase profits. We’re headquartered conveniently between Boulder and Denver with a beautiful view of the front range right outside our window. We’re growing and looking for a few committed professionals to help us scale. If you love the concept of combining drone-gathered imagery with Data Science then we might be your next great adventure.

Our Values: Team Accountability, Social Impact, Intellectual Growth



Job Description

As a member of the GeoVisual team, your role is critical in building tools that consume and transform data sets into readily available information for analysis by the team. You understand the fundamentals of statistical methods that underlie machine learning and relish the opportunity to put them into practice. Engineering data pipelines and visualizations that shed light on the complexities of our research is your passion. You have an entrepreneurial spirit and the idea of using data to help the world grow healthy food and protect its natural resources excites you. If you are ready for your next challenge – let’s talk!

Your Values: Social Impact, Optimization, Intellectual Curiosity

Spend your days:

  • Creating and maintaining data pipe architecture optimizing ML data delivery to analyze growth and predict yields using drone, satellite, and weather data
  • Leveraging historical and real-time data that will allow informed labor and equipment scheduling
  • Productionizing models into UI for visualization to leveraging data
  • Designing, constructing, installing, testing, and maintaining highly scalable data pipelines
  • Getting involved in developing the creative vision, design, development, and delivery of some amazing remote sensing solutions


Qualifications

What you’ll bring to the table:

  • Undergraduate degree in Math or Engineering – Advanced degree preferred
  • At least 3 years of experience as a data engineer using Python and PyTorch
  • Demonstrated comprehensive experience with data modeling and data visualization – bonus points for GIS or Geo-Positioning exposure
  • High proficiency with AWS infrastructure
  • Knowledge of deep learning modeling techniques and trends, especially CNN based model architectures for computer vision applications
  • Ability to build processes that support data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency, and workload management
  • Comfortable working within an Agile framework
  • Creative, articulate, and competent communication style – you deliver your messages clearly, concisely, and confidently
  • Strong interest in continuous learning and keeping up with emerging ML trends
  • You have worked in a small company so you know what it means to shift priorities and wear many hats
  • Desire to contribute to a team who is doing great things for humanity


Additional Information

Our team members enjoy:

  • Salary $90 - $115k plus benefits
  • An engaged, committed team of thought leaders to hang out with every day
  • The opportunity to get in on the ground floor and help build a truly impactful company

Goldstone Partners is helping this scrappy, and talented team find focused professionals who want to help improve crop yield for the global population. Principals only please. Applications welcome from US Citizens and Green Card Holders.

title: Product Owner
description:
About Ferryhopper

 

Ferryhopper is an online travel company based in Athens, Greece. We specialise in ferry ticket sales, powered by our in-house search engine which compares ferry ticket prices and itineraries across 10 different countries, including Greece, Italy, Spain, and Turkey.

Ferryhopper has revolutionised the online ferry ticket booking process by simplifying all the complexities of ferry ticket selection: from itineraries to seats, cabins to motorbikes, and campervans to foot-passenger tickets.

We are relentless in our thrive for improving our product and the services that we provide to our users. In this respect we are looking for a Product Manager who will be responsible for the web application of Ferryhopper. We value people who enjoy analyzing needs, spotting opportunities and providing solutions even in non-well-defined problems.

 

 

Role description

 

Do you love travelling with ferries? Do you get passionate about making travel arrangements easy and exciting? If yes, then Ferryhopper is the right place!

As a Product Team in Ferryhopper we are always looking to deliver excellent products that make the life of travellers better and easier. We go the extra mile and provide solutions for ferry travellers even in non-well defined problems.

As a Product Owner of our website, you will have the opportunity to change the way people perceive online ferry booking. Within our team you will be responsible for leading the full life-cycle of new features, driving the respective vision, strategy and roadmap. By definition, this role is cross-functional and you will be working closely with development, design, marketing, operations, customer care, and commercial teams, to bring what matters into life.

The ideal candidate will have a track record of owning and managing technology products from conceptualization to launch, show a deep customer focus, and have a mature business judgment. Highest levels of quality in products and customer experience are among our key values in Ferryhopper and what this role will strive to deliver.

 

The key responsibilities:

  • Explore customer needs and receive user feedback;
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their needs;
  • Work side-by-side with our developers and designers;
  • Participate and contribute to the scrum rituals of the team;
  • Prioritize projects and set goals aligned with the product strategy;
  • Own the product roadmap for the website team;
  • Break down complex ideas into executable features and priorities;
  • Define the MVP of each feature and prioritize the issues respectively;
  • Produce detailed and clear specifications for new product features, appropriately comprehensible by the engineering teams;
  • Ensure the quality of the feature to be released;
  • Measure the success and usage of the features and ensure their constant improvement.
The profile

The succesful candidate, 

Must have:

  • At least 2 years of experience in product management and at least 4 years of experience in digital products;

  • A proven track record of bringing to life experiences that users love, shown through your ability to conceptualize, define and deliver;

  • Comfort with transforming vague ideas into clear actions;

  • A sharp, analytical mind: your decisions are data-driven and supported by the data that you have researched and collected;

  • Familiarity with project / task management tools (Youtrack, JIRA, Trello, Asana, etc.);

The health of our company and the success of our products is directly related to the health of our team and the work environment we create for ourselves. With this in mind, we strive to provide an inclusive and positive working environment. In this respect, we offer:

 

  • Quick professional development.

title: Supplier Development Manager
description:

Location: Remote (HQ currently in Montreal)
Expected Start Date: ASAP
Salary: 60k$-80k$ based on experience

The Challenge

Axya is looking for a an innovative and structured problem solver with a mechanical engineering background. The candidate must have experience that relates to the supplier side (companies that fabricate goods and quotes on RFQs) of the industry in which Axya is currently operating : the north-american metal manufacturing industry.

We are looking for candidates with experience such as supplier development engineer within a large organization, supplier operations and management (quoting, fabrication, management,...) etc. The candidate would work in the Network Engineering department whose main goal is to support and build the supplier side of our network and find opportunities through network data analytics and customer research to increase the value we deliver to our customers (analytics and strategy).

 

The main goal of this job will be to focus on structuring and operating (with the help of the rest of the team) the supplier development pipeline/strategy to add new qualified suppliers within our network. With that comes the monitoring and management of the current supplier network to maximize their perceived value of Axya.

The candidate would also collaborate with other departments, such as sales, product and marketing to transfer insights and structure action plans.

We are a fast-growing technology start-up company. Our product is an online platform that connects buyers and suppliers working in the manufacturing industry.

More than 700 companies use the Axya platform. The platform is in constant development and artificial intelligence projects are currently underway.

Tasks involved:

  • Understanding and improving the current supplier development strategy and pipeline : Monitor KPI, Dispatch operations to other teammates to attain objectives, propose new strategy to attain KPIs, etc.
  • Monitor and analyse the network through data activity dashboards on a weekly basis to understand supplier behavior, flag opportunities and be proactive in understanding/predicting those behavior.
  • Analyse fundamental problematics, understand root cause and think of a strategy to validate an opportunity by doing customer research, fast (lean) prototyping, etc.
  • Once an opportunity is well defined and minimally validated, develop more structured processes to manage the operations more efficiently and on a larger scale. The next step is often to document the opportunity and the current manual processes in place by the department to transfer knowledge to other department such as the product department to think of a way to scale things.
  • Also some customer facing and operational responsibilities such as operating processes and improving them, answering customer requests, etc. for our supplier network.

Requirements

Must-have

  • Fluent in French and English for both speaking and writing

What do you need to succeed?

  • In depth understanding on how suppliers operate in the north-american metal manufacturing industry
  • Solid knowledge of the manufacturing industry [materials, manufacturing processes, certifications, standards, limitations of processes, realities of the industry etc.]
  • Ability to support technical manufacturing projects: understanding of technical drawings, understanding supplier requests, assessments of the manufacturability of parts, recommendations upon decision making, etc.
  • Mechanical Engineering background
  • Autonomous, well organized and strong sense of initiative
  • Strong data analytics and strategic thinking
  • Fast learner who is tech-fluent

Good-to-haves:

  • Industry experience
  • Customer Service Experience

Benefits

Why be part of our team?

  • Unlimited vacation policy
  • Group employee insurance program
  • Work at any time you want from wherever you want
  • Join a dynamic and highly collaborative team
  • Continuous training and professional development

About Axya

Axya is an innovative technology company that standardizes, automates, and centralizes the subcontracting process for buyers and suppliers in the manufacturing industry. It has developed the best technological solution for all companies that have manufacturing needs or capabilities in CNC machining, sheet metal, and welded assembly. All this to make the process easier, faster, and less expensive than the traditional method.

title: Recruiter

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Company Introduction

Verikai is an insurance technology company changing the way the industry views risk with true predictive analytics. Our well-established database includes over 4,000 behavior attributes for 250+ million people in the United States and provides deep insight to these individuals’ true health risks. With this data, we help insurance companies improve underwriting precision, speed and efficiency using alternative data and machine learning – and ultimately, we provide consumers and small businesses with greater access to a broader range of insurance products.

Verikai isn’t your typical startup. And we aren’t looking for typical employees. For starters, we are a fully remote organization, meaning your home base can be your sofa, your favorite café, or a (wifi-equipped) cabin in the woods. All you need is your brain and a laptop…and we provide the laptop. We’re looking for people who want to do inspired work for a higher purpose. We are a growing and well-funded tech startup with a great product and even better ideas. If you want to make an immediate impact on the way the insurance industry operates while working in a fun, fast-paced and supportive environment, you’ve come to the right place.

About the role

As part of the analytics team at Verikai, you will be in front of real customer issues and the data they generate in real time. You will be tasked with analyzing large-scale datasets and rewarded by witnessing your analysis been leveraged by the customers and creating tremendous value for them. You will have the opportunity to train yourself, with help from more senior team members, on using various data tools to analyze various types of complex datasets. You will also be able to manipulate our cutting-edge machine learning platform and improve it to build insightful models while learning and practicing how to build a truly operational model. Our start up culture will allow you to will work closely with all aspects of the business, and really shine on building up our analytics process and infrastructure.

Responsibilities

  • Develop cutting-edge machine learning algorithms, complement to our proprietary modeling platform, to extract greater lift from our data and provide more value for the customers
  • Refine/tailor our proprietary machine learning algorithm to better fit into various scenarios presented by the customers and our own visions
  • Constantly look for useful attributes to expand our core data assets from various data sources, like US census bureau, and validate the usefulness of the new data
  • Utilize proper tools to clean customer data, like PySpark, R, Python, or Excel, to prepare for upcoming data analysis or modeling exercises
  • Conduct descriptive analysis or other statistical analysis on customer data to identify valuable patterns to guide customers’ business decisions. Analyze the data creatively so that the results directly meet what customers want
  • Help prepare presentations or other customer-facing materials to demonstrate the value of our insights and to educate the customers on what we did and how we did it
  • Present the results/findings/models to customers as a technical expert, an industry insider, and a company promoter

Skills and Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree or above in Statistics, Mathematics, or Computer Science with 3-5 years of relevant working experience
  • Demonstrates experience dealing with large datasets and creating models to solve real customer problems; Experience of modeling insurance data is a plus
  • Deep knowledge in statistical modeling, knowing what’s good and what’s bad and how to tweak the parameters
  • Proficient in Python or R, familiar with PySpark and Excel
  • Critical and independent thinking, able to establish logical assumptions and think through scenarios
  • Creative, open-minded, and positive attitude when challenges present themselves
  • Not afraid of doing independent research, not settling on trivial progress
  • Attention to detail; Sense of ownership in your work
  • Effective communication, able to explain complex statistical terms and results to both technical and non-technical audiences

With Storyblok, your build is decoupled from the presentation layer so you can choose any frontend instead of being tied to a monolith. We are headless with a visual editor, this lets content creators make changes without needing tech knowledge. Therefore, you can focus on the important things.

  • Help enterprise customers to understand and get value out of Storyblok in workshops, tutorials, and during customer demos.

  • Represent Storyblok online through the written word, event attendance, and public speaking.

  • Videos of previous talks.

  • Up to date Macbook.

title: Product Manager, Machine Learning and Infrastructure
description:
About Impira

At Impira, we empower people to focus on their superpowers by automating away the routine. Millions of people spend hours each day rekeying data from documents and manually cataloguing paperwork. Impira allows nontechnical users to extract clean and structured data from files using artificial intelligence, making these processes instant and automatic. In just a few minutes, a user can drag-and-drop files into Impira, label a few examples, and sit back while Impira takes care of the rest. 

Under the hood, the Impira platform consists of advanced machine learning, database, and UI technology. Our key innovation is one-shot learning which allows a machine to learn from just one data point (in real time) and continue to learn from every interaction. One-shot learning is what allows users to extract data within five minutes of making an account. As you can imagine, this powerful innovation can drive automation for a litany of business processes across nearly any industry, allowing orgs to recover countless work hours. We're proud to not only meaningfully impact companies' bottom line but also boost employee morale and creativity with our product.

Delivering an elegant, simple user experience for extracting data from complex documents is no easy task and it requires heavy collaboration across disciplines. We believe that operating with autonomy, trust, and support enables our employees to harness their superpowers and achieve extraordinary outcomes. The leadership at Impira focuses on providing transparent context, coaching for long-term success, and getting out of the way. Our core values are empathy, empowerment, continuous improvement, boldness, ownership, and integrity.

The Opportunity

As a Product Manager of Machine Learning and Infrastructure at Impira, you take charge in making this vision a reality. If you enjoy working directly with innovative customers and excel at finding low-overhead approaches to working with and focusing top-tier engineering talent, we’d be thrilled to speak with you. You will report directly to the Head of Product. Our product team has a remote-first culture; we are 100% remote. We are looking to fill this role in early 2022.

Day-to-Day Responsibilities

  • Owning and running the full Product Lifecycle - from Ideation to End-of-Life - for Impira’s Machine Learning and Infrastructure teams.

  • Working with Engineering and Product Design teams to prioritize and manage product backlogs and schedules, to create an accurate and flexible product roadmap for your products.

  • Working with Sales, Customer Success, and Customer Support to prioritize customer requests, solve customer problems, drive product overviews, and present product roadmaps.

  • Working closely with Impira’s Executive team, Sales, and Marketing teams to define product and go-to-market strategy and subsequently implement it.

  • Assisting in hiring out and collaborating with the growing Product Management team.

What we’re looking for: 

  • 3-5 years of product management or software engineering experience.

  • Experience with Machine Learning and/or Infrastructure.

  • Excellent business and communication skills, spoken and written.

  • Able to break down highly technical projects into milestones.

  • A predisposition towards analyzing how customers work and leveraging a “first principles” approach to developing products which drive efficiency.

  • High degree of comfort and skill with Agile and cloud-native development.

  • BA/BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience preferred.

  • Curiosity, growth mindset, self-starter.

Impira is remote-friendly, headquartered in San Francisco and has raised Series B funding from top institutional investors and industry leaders, including Lightspeed Venture Partners, General Catalyst, and Coatue. Our investors and advisors are hands-on and work closely with us to achieve our aspirations.

To all recruitment agencies: Impira does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to Impira employees. Impira is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with the Company.

title: Product Manager: Core Tax / Bookkeeping
description:
About Found:

The self-employed workforce is a rapidly growing, resilient, and colorful 60 million Americans. But self-employment comes with its own set of challenges: navigating taxes, accounting, bookkeeping, and business banking are just a few. That’s where we come in.

Found is building tools that give self-employed people the security and peace of mind that has historically only been possible at big corporations. We’re a business bank account that automates taxes and expense tracking, because we believe small business owners should spend more time doing what they love and less time on their business finances.

We’re looking for kind, resourceful, and passionate people to join us in building the safety net for self-employment.

About the role:

Hi, I'm MA, Head of Product at Found. We're looking to add an exceptional product manager to join the Found team. Our customers consistently cite our tax features as one of the most valuable areas of the Found service. 

This role is for the PM owner of these beloved tax and bookkeeping features, including the core in-house tax stack, and any third-party integrations or partnerships we pursue over time. The ideal candidate is someone who has a background in accounting or experience working in tax/ accounting-adjacent products and has a knack (and passion!) for solving detail-oriented problems while still delivering a clean and clear user experience. 

Day to day, you will:

  • Own all core bookkeeping and tax flows within the Found app & desktop products (i.e. taxes onboarding flow/ tax profile, tax estimates, tax document generation, quarterly tax payment flows, “Activity” bookkeeping tab and categorization functionality, etc.) 

  • Build & maintain the roadmap for continuously leveling up both our bookkeeping and tax experiences for our customers, leveraging research and data insights to prioritize feature improvements and net-new feature buildout. 

  • Pair closely with Engineering, Design, Data, and Legal/ Compliance to bring this roadmap to life, ensuring feature launches are bug-free, hit SLAs, and adhere to the latest and greatest in state and federal-level tax codes. 

  • Drive OKRs, quarterly goal-setting, and regular check-ins on progress-against-goals for the Core Tax/ Bookkeeping product area. 

  • Help drive the development of helpful tax and bookkeeping-related content for our users, complementing our in-app experience with out-of-app resources for our customers to feel prepared and empowered to own their own self-employed taxes and bookkeeping. See our current Guides for inspiration. 

To thrive in this role, you:

  • Have 3+ years in a PM capacity, building end-to-end user-facing products. Previous experience in accounting or working with accounting/ tax prep products is a bonus. 

  • Are excited to partner closely with Design on complex, highly-detailed accounting and tax flows. Ability to easily distill complex concepts into simple, elegant design solutions. 

  • Data-driven prioritization bias- you are finger-tippy with data and excited to build a roadmap prioritized by both quantitative and qualitative inputs. 

  • Have outstanding in-person & written communication skills. Your superpower is explaining complex concepts to your teammates, your cross-functional partners, and your users in a clear, concise, and actionable manner! 

  • Have an owner mindset- you are always pushing the boundaries of the user experience and advocating for the customer. You bring the team along with you by regularly sharing roadmaps, prioritization tradeoffs, and wins/ learnings. 

About You:

Found is built by a team that comes from a variety of backgrounds and experiences, and we firmly believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are crucial to our success. As we grow, we’re searching for passionate and motivated team members who are excited to bring their skill set to the team and are ready to learn from others.

If you are looking for a role where you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful contribution and great impact, we would love to hear from you!

Perks & Benefits Of Found

  • 401K, FSA, and Commuter Benefits: We offer all employees access to tax-efficient benefit options alongside competitive base compensation.

  • Paid parental leave: Found supports employees through all stages of life, which is why new parents employed by Found qualify for 16 weeks of flexible parental leave.

  • Health benefits: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision benefits and are always 100% covered for employees, 75% covered for dependents.

  • Work anywhere: We have Found offices in both SF and Seattle, and for team members who work outside those cities, Found also supports fully remote working.

  • Meaningful equity: Everyone on our team should feel and act like an owner, which is why Found offers industry-competitive equity to all of our employees.

  • Flexible vacation policy: Vacations, appointments, mental health days- take the time you need, whenever you need to with our flexible time-off policy.

To learn more about our benefits or the team please go to Found.com/careers.

title: Brand Partnerships Specialist
description:
We’re Convictional. We are building a modern B2B trade network. 

 

Each year, trillions of dollars worth of B2B trade is transacted using Electronic Data Interchange (EDI). EDI is difficult for modern businesses to work with. Convictional is changing that. 

 

Our Supplier Enablement Platform enables retailers and marketplaces to onboard, integrate, and transact with all of their suppliers. Convictional's API-driven infrastructure is used by large retailers like Staples, Indigo, Harry Rosen, and Equinox, and brands like Caraway, Detox Market, and Therabody. We recently raised a Series A financing to scale our impact to even more companies.

 

Convictional's platform is informed by thousands of hours of customer consultation and a deep appreciation for both the buyer and seller perspectives. We are continuing to learn about the massive value to be unlocked from all types of B2B trade, including marketplace, dropship and wholesale. We’re aiming at theoretical maximums, not feature-completeness, and intend to bring as many businesses along with us as we can.

 

Taking a new approach to an old problem is nothing special. Our team, and how we engage with each other, is. We are proud to be building a home for kind nerds who want to impact global trade. Our team is strengthened when we take a learning-first approach and seek out opportunities to debate the best customer-focused solutions. We value self-awareness and feel compelled to fully explore the hard questions. 

 

We are a fully distributed team with people located across Canada and the US. We encourage you to design your work schedule and environment so they’re optimal for you. We use email, not Slack. We default to no internal meetings and Deep Work Wednesdays. We expect you to go to coaching or therapy at least occasionally and adhere to 10% compound time.

 

We are inspired every day by the opportunity to pioneer infrastructure that will move trillions of dollars worth of B2B trade. We welcome those who want to join us.



About the role

We are seeking a Brand Partnerships Specialist to join our Success team in playing an integral role growing Enterprise Customers’ businesses. Our Brand Partnerships Specialist will: 

 

  • Own Convictional’s overarching strategy for Merchandising as a Service (our term for Strategic Sourcing)

  • Present merchandising as a service to potential new Buyers alongside the Sales team to grow adoption.

  • Match a retailer’s vision for merchandising and sourcing efforts.

  • Innovatively source and value-sell Convictional’s Seller Network to existing Buyers who have yet to adopt Merchandising as a Service.

  • Maintain Top of Funnel for our Seller WOW Funnel (time-to-first-value) so Buyers never lack for ideas

  • Find creative ways to leverage and expand upon existing customer relationships and sellers already in Convictional’s Seller Network (wholesale opportunities, new product ideas, seasonal assortments).

  • Create systems for strategically matching Enterprise buyers with sellers in Convictional’s Seller Network

  • Manage a team of sourcing virtual assistants to exponentially increase their impact

  • Enable our Enterprise Customer Success Managers to focus more on consultative business relationships and customer advocacy and less on finding great brand partners for their accounts.

  • Achieve approved seller sourcing targets across a portfolio of retailers.

  • Proactively identifies areas requiring improvement (in process or technology); seeks out and recommends solutions.


Our Brand Partnerships Specialist:

  • Is open-minded and loves experimenting with novel inbound and outbound sourcing strategies.

  • Is motivated by accelerating the impact of the people around them.

  • Has the special sauce for finding up-and-coming brands that would be intriguing to many Enterprise Buyers

  • Believes accurate and timely communication (and maintaining their CRM) are an easy way to unblock progress.

  • Thinks systemically and futuristically when identifying opportunities and building relationships.

  • Is entrepreneurial and creative in thinking with respect to how our Buyers can grow their business.


Experience

  • 3-5 years progressive experience in a retail/e-commerce or B2B purchasing environment

  • Undergraduate degree in Business, Commerce, or Supply Chain Management, though we recognize that there are many valid paths to acquiring this knowledge

  • Experience doing sourcing or procurement for a North American household name retail brand is considered an asset

  • Familiarity with modern e-commerce trade systems and sourcing software (i.e. dropship programs, platforms and back-office software, emerging market trends).

  • Comfort navigating bespoke commercial requirements


Compensation

  • $80-90,000 Salary + incentive comp + options

  • Comprehensive benefits, including a Healthcare Spending Account

  • WFH stipend, learning budget, and corporate cards to ensure you’re never waiting for reimbursement

  • 3 weeks paid vacation + one week shut down at the end of the year

Disclaimer

We are only prepared to hire candidates currently living in Canada and the United States and are unable to consider other international applicants.

If this role doesn’t sound like you, but you believe you have something to contribute, tell us why in an email. We will read it, and we will reply to you with thoughtful feedback about whether or not you may be a good fit for us.

title: Field Application Engineer – Industrial Automation
description:
Company Description

Delta Group established our EMEA operation in 1995 with region headquarters in Hoofddorp near Amsterdam to pursue Delta's corporate mission: "To provide innovative, clean and efficient energy solutions for a better tomorrow."​ For nearly 20 years, Delta EMEA continues to dedicate in R&D to support the most important businesses with advanced energy-saving technology and solutions. With the acquisition of Energy Systems business from Ascom, a Swiss company in 2003, and Eltek ASA, a Norwegian company in April 2015, Delta has inherited the excellent engineering resources and power design knowledge since 1906 and further development into telecom, industrial and medical markets. It is a significant step forward in Delta’s ability to offer complex high-power solutions, a broader product portfolio and strengthened Delta's position in the European market.



Job Description

We are looking for a Field Application Engineer for Industrial Automation products to support to the customer in Italy and specifically for the Emilia Romagna area.

title: Sr. Director/VP of Product
description:
At Standard Cognition, we’re revolutionizing the way the world shops. By replacing cash registers with computer vision-powered checkout, we’re creating a frictionless experience for shoppers. Since launching in 2017, Standard has contracts with multiple global retailers and is in the process of deploying our Standard Checkout solution across thousands of stores globally. We’re backed by some of Silicon Valley’s leading investors including Softbank, CRV, Initialized, EQT, Draper Associates, and YCombinator. We announced our Series C in February 2021!

The Product team at Standard Cognition transforms cutting-edge technology into elegant user experiences that delight shoppers while elevating the brick and mortar experiences our retail partners offer.

As our Head of Product, you will report to the COO and be responsible for driving the product strategy and vision to deliver a differentiated retail experience. While successfully executing across numerous technologies, you will solve difficult operational problems for our retail customers while shaping the vision of autonomous checkout for shoppers. You will work at the intersection of technologies that are used across the company, weaving together our various technologies from on-premise to cloud compute, our AI and ML stack, our retailer product catalog system, to our POS and payments integrations - creating plenty of opportunities to work on challenging and interesting problems.

This is a full-time, remote role that can be based anywhere in the US.

What you'll do here:

  • You will deliver a clearly-defined and compelling Standard Checkout roadmap that shapes Standard’s future product strategy, design, and execution. This multi-year product/program/platform roadmap will create world-class experiences across the customer journey from product discovery, to commerce, through customer support and ownership.
  • You will build and mentor a world-class, multi-disciplinary team of Product Managers and UX experts, and foster a culture of collaboration and data-driven decision making across product, program management, UX, and engineering.
  • You will implement strong product management processes, nurturing and growing our product team in best and sustainable practices to consistently ship quality product that solves the right problems at the right time.
  • You will create and present visionary innovations (occasionally in front of investors or analysts) and define OKRs (objectives and key results) to communicate vision, priorities, and success metrics, across various product initiatives.
  • You will craft a thoughtful and balanced approach between various stakeholders, who may have competing priorities; leverage strong communication and negotiation skills and strong technical background to align on approach and strategy.
  • You will transform abstract and intangible ideas and situations across all functional areas of the business, identify and evaluate fundamental issues, drive prioritization and trade-off decision-making, providing strategy and direction for major programs and building detailed product roadmaps.


Who you are:

  • Strong product management experience (e.g. creating strategic product roadmap(s) from conception to launch and working with cross-functional teams)
  • You are a leader and an entrepreneur
  • You are creative and have a desire to build
  • You have a track record of high-scale technology launches: e.g. millions of customers
  • You have strong product management skills: proven track record of launching complex product features by collaborating with cross-functional teams
  • You have effective communication skills; demonstrated ability to engage and influence senior executives and colleagues alike
  • You can juggle multiple priorities and make things happen in a fast-paced, dynamic environment


Only meet some of these traits or experiences? We'd still love to hear from you!


Why you might want to work with us:

  • We take care of you and your family with health, vision, and dental insurance.
  • You will have the option to contribute to a 401k.
  • You're excited to work on a product that will impact almost any consumer, almost anywhere.
  • Standard is a remote-first company. We trust you to get your job done in the location that works best for you.
  • We dress casually. Some of us wear slippers in the office. In current work-from-home standings, we’re super comfy.
  • We believe in a culture of learning, and want to keep building our skills, experiences, and capabilities.
  • We offer flexible work schedules. We trust our team to know how they will do their best work.
  • We're family-friendly. We want our teammates to focus on what they need to do when they need to do it.
  • We offer very competitive compensation, including equity in Standard, to every one of our employees.


Standard provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.

Not quite ready to apply? Send us an email at jobs@standard.ai. Someone from the team will follow up to answer your questions.

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
What we’re doing
Did you know it takes a member of congress, on average, 45 days to respond to even the most basic constituent request? We view this as a fundamental breakdown in the UX of representative democracy and we're building a platform to fix it.
 
Indigov is a constituent relationship management suite for the modern representative. Our platform reduces average response times from weeks to minutes for 90% of incoming messages. After going through an exhaustive technical and legal review process with the House of Representatives, we recently closed our Series A and are live in hundreds of offices across federal, state, and local governments. We are expanding rapidly and need additional team members to join us in our pursuit to build the future of representative democracy.
 
Who we are
We are a group of technologists and entrepreneurs passionate about increasing the efficiency of representative democracy for both representatives and those they serve. We have been executives, technicians, and leaders at institutions such as U.S. Congress, Google, Dropbox, USDS, as well as large e-commerce, digital-first media, civic and gov-tech companies.
 
Who we are
We are a group of technologists and entrepreneurs passionate about increasing the efficiency of representative democracy for both representatives and those they serve. We have been executives, technicians, and leaders at institutions such as U.S. Congress, Google, Dropbox, USDS, as well as large e-commerce, digital-first media, civic and gov-tech companies.
 
What you’ll do
• Generate new business opportunities to fuel the sales pipeline
• Maintain active engagement with new and existing leads 
• Efficiently respond and qualify inbound marketing leads
• Create a phenomenal first impression with our prospects and customers by providing them with a positive experience
• Research and build new and existing accounts (i.e.: adding contacts, emails, strategic calling)
• Conduct high level conversations with legislators in prospect accounts
• Achieve monthly quotas of qualified opportunities and closed business
 
About you
• Minimum of 1 year of previous B2B SaaS prospecting experience
• A track record of top performance
• A highly motivated, driven, and self-starting individual
• Ability to work in a fast paced, team environment
• Excellent time management/organizational skills
• Excellent communication style (outgoing phone presence)
• Excellent written/verbal communication skills
• A deep personal alignment with the Indigov mission of making government more efficient and effective through technology
 
 
What makes an ideal candidate
• Passion. Building beautiful products that take complex tasks and make them feel simple and intuitive
• Accountability. In a small team of early employees, it is crucial that we all own the outcome and quality of the work we do. The buck always stops with you!

Working at Indigov

• Equal opportunity employer

Digital Marketing Account Manager

Intuitive Digital is a fast-paced, joyful and values-based digital marketing agency in Portland. We are looking for an optimistic, intelligent, innovative person to support with our fast-growing Digital Marketing company.

title: React Native Engineer
description:
About Sharp Therapeutics

SharpTx is a well-funded Digital Therapeutics (DTx) company with the mission to add life to years for millions of people.

We build and deliver DTx solutions in close collaboration with our world-leading clinical partners to help users prevent and manage Central Nervous System (CNS) conditions. Our first product is a mobile app called Sharp that empowers 50+-year-old users to track their cognition via clinically-validated risk assessment and reduce their individual risk of future dementia through data-driven lifestyle and brain coaching. Through direct consumer engagement and the integration of state-of-the-art clinical science, working on Sharp is a unique opportunity to radically improve mental health care for the millions of people at risk.

 

DETAILED MISSION

SharpTx is now seeking a talented React Native/React Engineer to own and drive technical projects from specification through to delivery and beyond. We have a product-oriented team, releasing apps regularly. The ideal candidate is mobile savvy, loves tech, has a passion for digital health and understands what makes a great mobile app!

The role is fully remote with the majority of the team based in the UK and France.

The interviews and all internal communications are in English.

 

  • Hands-on development: analyse product specifications, design implementations, write code and deliver features
  • Contribute technical ideas and suggestions to enhance the direction of the product
  • Communicate closely with Product and Design teams
  • Write efficient, maintainable and reusable code and tests.
  • Be enthused about new technologies: TypeScript, React Native for cross platform mobiles apps and Serverless for backend (our engineers and full-stack and deliver features for both mobile and backend).
  • Work with QA in a regular release cycle.

 

Requirements

Compulsory :

  • 2+ years of experience as a software developer.
  • At least 1 years’ experience in React or React Native.
  • A solid understanding of mobile apps and the underlying technology behind them.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Passionate about mobile apps.
  • Based within +/- 4 hours London time

 

Nice to Have :

  • Experience with typed languages.
  • Experience with native iOS / Android technologies.
  • Experience working with AWS.
  • Experience working with QMS and ‘software as medical device’ regulated products.

 

About the stack :

  • TypeScript for both mobile and backend.
  • React Native.
  • Redux with Sagas.
  • Serverless framework on top of AWS Lambda.
  • Detox.
  • CircleCI

Benefits

  • Fully remote - while we are all remote working, flexible working to us means full autonomy in how you work and organise your day at home, around childcare or other responsibilities
  • 25 days annual holiday
  • You are eligible to participate in the company's equity plan
  • £1000 annual Learning & Development budget

 

WHY WORK WITH US

  • Come work with us if you’re passionate about using technology to solve significant healthcare problems and make a genuinely positive impact on the world.
  • We offer a competitive salary package including equity and a front-row seat to the early stages of building an ambitious startup led by repeat entrepreneurs.
  • Full remote opportunity. We believe in giving people full autonomy in how they want to organise their days. Autonomy, challenges, and accountability empower us to grow as professionals and lead to the greatest outcome for the company

 

Our Company Mission & Values

  • Our mission is to develop life-changing medical-grade products for one of the largest healthcare issues of our time.
  • We are a diverse team that is united by a common objective. We embrace and respect each other’s perspective and skillset. We celebrate successes and failures together by championing radical candor.
  • When hiring, we value intellectual curiosity, ambition, and attention to detail.

 

Diversity and Inclusion

  • SharpTx is committed to providing a diverse and inclusive environment for everyone, free from discrimination or harassment. We flourish through different perspectives and foster an environment where we can thrive, belong and do impactful work.
  • SharpTx is an equal opportunity employer, fully compliant with the Equality Act. We are dedicated to considering all qualified applicants without regards to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, family or parental status, disability, age, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic as required by applicable law of the locations we operate in.

title: People Operations Coordinator
description:
About Bunny Studio

Bunny Studio is the world’s only project fulfillment platform that provides over 50 end-to-end creative services. Powered by technology and run by humans, it works with the top 4% of global professionals to deliver voiceovers, writing, video, design services, and more, in over 100 languages. With an extensive database of over 13,000 pre-vetted professionals, we back our risk-free policy with 24/7 support and lightning turnaround times. Our platform also renders developers and agencies unrivaled capabilities to scale their creative needs on-demand through its unique API integration. With Bunny Studio, our clients can expect predictable outcomes, affordability, and ingenuity always.

We're currently looking for somebunny to join our team as a People Operations Coordinator! This job opening is your invitation to raise your bar and team up with the world's best creatives. We've built an environment where our team members help each other proactively to thrive, and where a sense of humor is valued as much as technical and human skills.

🐰 Our team: We're currently with 87 people globally distributed. Over the last 12 months, we've grown the team by ~80%. We come from different backgrounds; scientists, parents, designers, historians, engineers, writers, audio-visual producers, travelers, athletes, voice artists, pet-lovers, and more. We're all bunnies. As a collective, we refer to ourselves as the fluffle.

🌏 Our location: We're a remote-first team. We work from Brazil, Nigeria, The Netherlands, The Philippines, Colombia, Argentina, England, Uruguay, among other places. We don't have an office.

🚀 Our launching year: We were created in 2011 during a hackathon and launched in February 2012.

💖 Our clients: We've partnered with more than 15,000 businesses, to help them scale their creative needs over the years.

💸 Our investments: We're a bootstrapped business. We grow our investment capacity by bringing more value to our clients.

 

 

 
About the role

As a People Operations Coordinator, you'll focus on people as the value drivers of Bunny Studio. Your primary responsibility will be to drive improvements to our processes, functions, and services to better our bunnies' quality of work and life throughout their entire lifecycle with Bunny Studio.

In this role, you'll collaborate with bunnies at all levels to identify and close gaps in our people operations. You'll drive projects to help increase team member engagement within the organization. These include, but are not limited to, onboarding, career mobility, DEI, stay interviews, recognition, compliance, annual retreat event planning, and overall company culture.

Practicals

  • Functional leader: Maika Hoekman, Head of People Operations
  • Team: People Operations
  • Team members: Sheyla Scaffo, People Experience Associate
  • Location: Any location with considerable timezone overlap with Latin America
  • Start date: As soon as possible
 

💡 Challenges you'll work on

For the first 6-12 months, you can expect to help us work on the following challenges:

  • Partner with the Head of People Operations to define a level-based competency framework.
  • Lead the implementation and execution of a stay interview process.
  • Support in defining our team and organizational growth strategy.
  • Collaborate with the Head of People Operations to improve our Bunnyversary program.
  • Drive the implementation of the creation of welcome packages for new bunnies joining the fluffle.
 

🔎 Specifics on the responsibilities

  • Provide our bunnies a memorable experience throughout their whole lifecycle within Bunny Studio.
  • Proactively identify process inefficiencies and inconsistencies and collaborate towards an improved and more productive process that improves the experience of the fluffle.
  • Support in designing and implementing People Operations processes and ensure proper documentation of these in the right places.
  • Work alongside the Head of People Operations and Legal team in ensuring labor compliance in the locations we hire new team members on international employment and contractual requirements.
  • Work alongside the Head of People Operations in researching, implementing, maintaining, reporting, and analyzing all People Operations programs. Specifically, support and improve program management, including rollout, communication, reporting, and KPIs of:
    • Organizational health
    • Engagement Survey
    • 360 feedback cycle
    • Performance Matrix Assessment.
    • Alumni program
  • Support Head of People Operations in tracking data on Benefits to report benefits usage throughout the year and collect external market data to support benefits roadmaps.
  • Share responsibility with the rest of the People Operations team for all our documentation in Confluence in the People Operations space.
  • Act as a thought partner to Head of People Operations and hiring managers, suggesting and implementing creative solutions to challenges that impact the candidate experience within our recruitment process.
  • Provide backup and guidance to the People Experience Associate in responding to our People-related Slack channels to ensure extraordinary customer service to our fluffle.
  • Along with the Head of People Operations, track various People-related metrics and make them public to the organization for easy access and tracking of processes.
  • Lead the design, implementation, and rollout of a stay interview process. Maintain and improve this process, including holding stay interviews for IC's.
  • Intake of questions, complaints, and concerns.
  • Review Bunnyversary gift feedback with the People Experience Associate and work to iterate on the experience and ordering process.
  • Drive the implementation and rollout of a process to ensure all new bunnies receive onboarding welcome packages.
  • Escalate any concerns or urgent matters related to employment relations to the Head of People Operations.
  • Provide support and cover for People Experience Associate when needed, including completion of Onboarding processes and Offboarding processes.
  • Identify gaps in our onboarding and co-employer processes.
  • Oversee probation period strategy, collaborating with the Legal team to ensure compliance and iteration globally.
  • Identify automation opportunities for all People Operations tasks and iterate on manual administrative processes.
  • Announce changes and improvements in our #co-whats-happening Slack channel.
  • Manage vendor contracts: renewing or ending contracts and working closely with the Head of People Operations and Finance on negotiations and vendor selections.
  • Coordinate with Finance on payroll processes.
  • Support in completing ad-hoc projects, reporting, and tasks of the People Operations team at Bunny Studio.
  • Conduct exit interviews for all ICs and collaborate closely with the team to support administration-related tasks.
  • Provide support to the Head of People Operations in building an employer brand.
    • Collaborate with our Branding squad to evolve Bunny Studio's employment brand strategy to effectively articulate Bunny Studio's culture and value proposition to attract top talent.
    • Collaborate with our Branding squad to enhance the look and feel of communications (internal and external) throughout the candidate and bunny lifecycle.
    • Distribute thoughtful and engaging employer brand content.
  • Collaborate with the Head of People Operations on our total rewards policies, processes, and procedures following our workflow, with the goal always being to make things more accessible from the perspective of the bunnies.
  • Administer and coordinate Parental Leave tasks while maintaining contact with the involved stakeholders to ensure completion of all functions while encouraging compliance and offering assistance as and when needed.
  • Maintains knowledge of legal requirements related to day-to-day management of team members, reducing legal risks, and ensuring regulatory compliance.

📈 KPIs for this role

  • Onboarding satisfaction survey > 4.5
  • 12-month team member retention
  • 12-month voluntary team member turnover
  • Offboarding satisfaction survey > 4.5

Requirements

  • You're enthusiastic about working with a high volume of tasks and responsibilities and dedicated to helping Bunny Studio build a qualified, diverse, engaged team.
  • Experience in leading projects, process improvements, and substantive change within (high-growth) organizations.
  • Writing and speaking English fluently is a must.
  • Prior experience within a People Operations or HR Operations team, ideally working in a tech-driven organization, is a plus.
  • Experience and knowledge in some of the following is a plus: professional development, DEI, organizational behavior, policy development, and labor law and compliance in one or multiple countries where bunnies are residing.
  • You've proven knowledge and experience in tracking and reporting (on people) data and metrics.
  • Organizational skills with great attention to detail while working in a fast-paced environment under tight deadlines and competing priorities.
  • The ability to work autonomously and drive your performance and development is essential in this role.
  • Strong conflict resolution skills and emotional intelligence.
  • When needed, you're able and willing to work odd hours—for example, participating in a podcast recording, assisting in a call with our lawyers, or calling an embassy in a different continent for a visa process as part of our annual retreat planning.
  • Team player who can jump in and support the team on a variety of topics and tasks.
  • Experience partnering with cross-functional team members and company leaders to understand and navigate organizational needs.
  • Exceptional customer service skills to consistently deliver a memorable experience to our candidates and bunnies.
  • Recognize and appropriately handle sensitive and confidential information.
  • Extensive experience with software tools and enthusiasm for learning new ones to optimize our people processes.
  • Experience with Google Workspaces, Confluence, Airtable, Slack, or Zoom is considered a plus.
  • Previous experience in using an HRIS and ATS, managing the data, and ensuring accuracy in these platforms is considered a plus.
  • You're able to take the initiative and build productive relationships with all levels of team members and candidates.
  • Willingness to work in an environment that strives for honest and open communication at all times.
  • You share our values (listed below) and work per those values.
  • You're a people person with empathetic and critical listening skills.
  • Previous work experience at a growth-stage tech company is considered a plus.
  • Experience working remotely is considered a plus.

 

✨ We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you. ✨

If you've any further questions and or concerns on any of the responsibilities or requirements, please feel free to add these to the very last question we've added in our application form. We'll get back to you with our answers.

 
Career path

You can expect to be in this role for 2 years. The knowledge and experience you'll gain may then enable you to perform any of the following positions, either at Bunny Studio or somewhere else:

  • People Ops Lead
  • People Ops Manager
  • People Experience Manager
  • Recruitment Lead
  • People Ops Specialist
  • Team member Relations Coordinator
  • Total rewards coordinator

 

 
💰 Compensation

The annual salary for this role is either $31,807.35 or $40,778.65. This depends on your level of skills and knowledge.

At Bunny Studio, we strive for equality amongst all our team members and actively ensure fair unbiased compensation along with competitive benefits. We’ve built a salary calculator that considers variables such as experience, skill level, geographical location. With this calculator, we ensure that bunnies at the same level get paid the same. Hence our salaries are non-negotiable during the hiring process. We kindly request that you confirm that the gross salary we offer is within your income expectations before you apply.

Benefits

We also offer:

  • 🚀 Stock options package: All Bunny Studio team members have access to Stock Options. The options package is determined based on your role and job level. All roles are eligible at Bunny Studio to have access to Stock Options, after completing their 90 days probation period, with the starting date being the date they joined the company.
  • 🌍 Remote-first: Live and work from wherever you want. We’ve been a fully distributed company since our founding date. We work with team members from all over the world. We trust you to get your work done wherever, whenever.
  • 🧘 Unlimited paid-time-off: No upper limit to the number of days you’d like to take to recharge. These include paid sick leave and mental health days. We adhere to local rules on holidays in each country. Currently, we are also experimenting with working a 4-day workweek.
  • 🩺 Health insurance: All Bunny Studio team members have access to paid medical health insurance. As a global remote-first company, we don't have a universal provider, so we'll coordinate directly with you on how to pay for it in your country.
  • 💓 Life insurance: All Bunny Studio team members are eligible for life insurance. As a remote-first company, we don't have a universal provider, so we'll coordinate directly with you on how to pay for it in your country.
  • 🧘 Mindfulness: One year of mindfulness with a Headspace account.
  • 🤝 Commitment to professional development: Once you pass your probation period, we will agree on your tour of duty, which defines a successful working partnership explicitly: You assume the commitment of focusing your time and energy on our team to grow the company; we presume the commitment of investing in your professional growth so that when the time comes for you to leave our team, you'll have the tools, experience, and network to achieve equal success elsewhere.
  • 🤔 Education budget: You'll have access to our education budget, from books to courses, and from coaching to in-person classes. We've built a comprehensive education framework and budget that you can use for your professional development plans.
  • 👨‍🍼 Paid parental leave: 4 months (or 16 weeks) of parental leave. We have built an inclusive, gender-neutral parental leave policy for anyone expecting a child through birth, surrogacy, adoption, or foster child placement in their home.
  • ✈️ Annual retreats: When we can, we meet in person for company get-togethers once per year.
  • 🥳 Bunnyversary gifts: Every new year being part of the fluffle is a significant milestone we want to celebrate with you and thank you for your time with us.
  • 🎂 Birthday cakes: Having the opportunity to wish you a happy birthday and celebrate the life of a great team member like you is a true gift. We will ensure to get you your favorite cake, brownies, or other preferred celebratory food at your doorstep.
  • 🏢 Coworking space support: Work from a co-working space instead of your home. Stipends vary per geo-location and needs.
  • 💻 Equipment: laptop, keyboard, mouse or trackpad, and noise-canceling headset to set you up for success from the get-go.
  • 🖥️ Home office setup: If you opt to work from home, we offer an annual stipend of $400- to set up your home office.
  • 📚 Free Kindle and books: Get a free Kindle during your onboarding and free books to get you started.

 

About the People Operations team

We invest our time designing memorable experiences for our bunnies so that they want to be here – present, engaged, and proud of being part of the Bunny Studio team! Our mission is to design the strategy and organizational structure to enable a culture of achievement and performance.


📈 Our team KPIs:

  • e-NPS >85
  • Team member engagement
  • Turnover rate < 10%
  • Success of recruitment
    • Time to hire
    • Plan vs. hire
 
How we work

🙌 Our culture and values

Bunny Studio is a remote-first company with a close-knit team that spans 20 countries and 5 continents. Behind the platform, we’re real people who celebrate diversity, individuality, and inclusion every day. We adopt a communicative digital culture that thrives on transparency, inquisitive learning, gifs, and emojis.

Our core values underpin how we work together day-to-day and the support we give to our customers and team members. We strive to empower our team members to be self-directed and self-motivated in their roles.

  • Think critically: We're reflective and open to challenge. As critical thinkers, we can use data to comprehensively explore issues, ideas, and events with a customer-centric approach before accepting or formulating an opinion or conclusion. If our perspectives and assumptions are mistaken or incomplete, we acknowledge it and are willing to change what we are doing or what we believe in the light of these critical insights.
  • Learn continuously. We're crazy about self-development and take every opportunity we can to learn. Every failure, victory, difficult conversation, and instance of feedback are a chance to learn and improve daily. When we fail, we take ownership of our mistakes, reflect on them and learn. When we succeed, we ensure we celebrate this and share our achievements with others.
  • Assert and empathize: We're candid in expressing our wants and needs while still considering the rights, demands, and wants of others. We make an effort to make ourselves understood by engaging in proactive communication. We ask questions when we are uncertain, speak up when having an opinion or idea, ask for help when we need it, question the status quo, and speak up when we feel reserved, embarrassed, or fear being wrong or upsetting people. If a conflict should arise, we are patient and receptive to other peoples' viewpoints. We are committed to helping others achieve success.
  • Innovate and adapt: We move forward with an adaptive mindset, and we're not afraid to do things differently or change the way we do things. We thrive in environments of constant change and see opportunities where others see risk. Our mindset doesn’t depend on scale or resources; instead, we draw on our creativity and scrappiness for varied solutions and optimization of opportunities.
  • Trust: We define trust as the belief and confidence in our people and organization's integrity, reliability, and fairness. We bring the best of who we are to our work, and we take ownership in collaborating, cooperating, and contributing to achieve our mission and ensure our customers have all the support they need to reach their creative goals.
  • Consistently deliver memorable experiences: We are committed to excellence and dedicated to raising the bar in making every user experience exceptionally memorable. Our customers should leave happy even if they don't buy from us. Clients and buyers should refer others to us, even if we didn't fulfill their projects. Talents should be excited, even if they don't pass our application process. Candidates for our job openings should love us and tell all their friends about us even if we don't hire them. Team members should love Bunny Studio - its people, processes, technology stack, payroll, culture, and more - even after leaving our team. We should be fanatical about delivering remarkable experiences.

Take a look behind the scenes of how we work. For more information on how we collaborate worldwide, check out our blog We Are Bunny Studio.

Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion

Throughout the whole organization, we aim to provide a multicultural experience and equal opportunities. You’ll be working in an engaging and safe environment where there's zero tolerance for any discrimination and harassment. We welcome applicants of any race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or other characteristics.

Taking action to bring about social change

We believe we have a responsibility to be the change we want to see. We have razor-sharp minds and considerable accumulated knowledge in the company that can and should apply for the greater good. Thus far, we’ve been able to support various social entrepreneurs and NGOs in ideating new and exciting solutions to pressing social issues. We encourage our team members to actively participate in social efforts and regularly support charitable campaigns for diverse causes.

In addition, we leverage our product to provide a 20% discount to NGOs. Please read about our NGO program here.

 

What you can expect from our hiring process

  2. Phone screen with the Head of People Operations
  3. (async) Technical case study

Bunny Studio is growing. Hop with us!

title: Director of Finance
description:
About DocStation

DocStation takes pharmacists from pills to patients. We analyze data provided to us by our partner health plans and pharmacies to find care opportunities where pharmacists can make a large impact on patient health. To make this work, we pair our easy-to-use interface with our efficient data pipeline to help pharmacists focus on what they do best: care for patients. We're an early stage company looking to transform the $3.2 trillion healthcare industry via the $450 billion pharmacy industry.


About the role

The Director of Finance is a key member of the senior management team responsible for ensuring the fidelity of the company’s accounting and finance processes, the success of the company’s financial initiatives, and communication of financial insights to other senior management.

We rely on a suite of industry leading technologies to manage our finance function, and have a strong preference for tech-forward, scalable solutions to our growing finance and accounting needs.


What you’ll do

  • Departmental leadership and oversight
  • Lead FP&A efforts with a focus on cash management and profitability improvement
  • Assist executive leadership with investor relations and fundraising initiatives
  • Ensure regulatory compliance in all financial matters
  • Design and enforce risk mitigation strategies
  • Maintain a robust control environment
  • Recruit and train additional members of the finance team
  • Liaise with outside counsel on legal and contractual matters

What you’ll bring to DocStation

  • Initiative to independently identify problems and bring solutions to the table
  • Experience building and managing remote teams
  • Experience in healthcare; specifically knowledge of the regulatory and compliance issues faced by companies in this industry.
  • Highly influential communication skills both internally and externally
  • The ability to distill complex finance or legal concepts into easily understood team communications.

Company benefits

  • Fully distributed company—work from wherever you're most comfortable
  • Competitive pay and equity
  • Great health benefits for you and family
  • Equipment you need to do your job, including a home office stipend

How to apply

Please submit your application with a highly detailed cover letter that describes why you believe you're a good fit for this particular position and anything else you'd like us to know. When answering the additional questions, please go into detail (we also love to read).

DocStation is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Bear Group is a leading website development firm dedicated to building and supporting websites and eCommerce solutions that help businesses grow. We're a remote-first company headquartered in Seattle and have helped hundreds of organizations—across a wide range of industries—align their technology to their business goals over the past 15 years. 

Our focus in web development enables us to develop deep expertise in Drupal, Magento, and Shopify and to provide top-notch custom solutions for clients. We're looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer to join our team. The DevOps Engineer needs to be self-motivated and able to work independently most of the time, but we have a friendly and capable team to collaborate with along the way. We value and support ongoing education and professional development to keep up with ever-evolving technologies and practices.

The type of work depends on the client, but often includes:

  • Execute safe and efficient deployment procedures across Bear Group clients
  • Review and merge code prior to deployments
  • Execute all code deployments to production tiers
  • Handle escalation support and help troubleshoot and resolve issues that may arise in client's server environments
  • Work directly with all members of the project management team on environment-related issues

General Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree plus 3+ years in a DevOps focused role
  • Preference for client service environments such as web development firms, technical support teams, interactive agencies, or graphic design firms
  • Independence, enthusiasm, superb written communication, and organization skills
  • Experience administrating Linux based servers, including Apache and Nginx, ideally with mod-php or php-fpm
  • Understanding of web application frameworks, ideally PHP based
  • Experience handling complex merges and conflict resolution in git
  • Working knowledge of Docker
  • Understanding of networking concepts, including DNS, routing, and caching

Working at Bear Group

title: Director of Security for mmhmm
description:
mmhmm is a video communication company helping people instantly produce live and recorded video presentations that are entertaining to watch and easy to make. Founded in 2020, we believe being better at video is a crucial skill for any successful modern business. As a fully distributed, global team ourselves, we’re on a mission to empower people who work on video (that is, nearly everyone) to create more sustainable and joyful ways to work, teach, and collaborate. Our growing team includes founding members of Evernote, and we’re backed by Sequoia Capital and other leading investors. mmhmm is part of All Turtles, a studio sharing resources to help multiple brands build meaningful products people love.

As our first team member focused solely on security, you will be responsible for building out our security practice. Working with the CTO you will build an understanding of the mmhmm tech stack and operational practices and create a plan for ensuring that we meet or exceed industry standards for security. You’ll do hands-on technical work to security and monitor our AWS accounts, ensure that we have sound security policies and practices, and work with business stakeholders such as our legal and sales teams. You’ll also build out your team, identifying key roles that we need to hire for and leading the recruiting, interviewing and hiring process for these roles.

You’re the right person for this role if you enjoy working in early-stage, fast-paced environments, have deep experience securing SaaS products, and understand how both attackers and customers assess the security of such products.

You’ll be responsible for:

  • Hands-on security review, remediation and monitoring of the mmhmm cloud service.
  • Hiring and managing a small team of experts to oversee application, infrastructure and corporate security.
  • Collaborating with legal to develop internal and external policies, documentation and training programs for security.
  • Supporting Sales and Customer Success conversations with prospects and customers regarding the security of our products.
  • Collaborating with development teams to ensure that we’re following security best practices and complying with security policies.

Ideally, you’ll have:

  • Significant experience in an information security role, preferably at a fast growing SaaS company, including significant experience with AWS.
  • Experience hiring and managing security experts.
  • Experience working with cybersecurity vendors for formal security assessments and audits.
  • Experience with formal security and compliance programs such as SOC 2.
  • Experience building and operating externally-facing security programs such as a responsible disclosure program.

The Director of Security is a full-time position reporting to the Chief Technology Officer. This role can be based in any location. Since our distributed team works across US time zones, North and South American-based applicants are preferred. We offer comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance to our employees and their dependents, as well as a suite of optional benefits and perks programs including parental leave and flexible PTO.

All Turtles and mmhmm are committed to creating and fostering a diverse team. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds and all walks of life to apply. We’re committed to providing reasonable accommodations to all applicants throughout the application process

title: Director of Public Policy
