title: Senior Product Designer (CDI) - H/F
description:
Company Description

Who are we? 💚

 

Serving 4 million students and recent graduates; 80,000 businesses; and a network of 700 higher education institutions in 25 European countries, JobTeaser is now the European leader for the recruitment of young talent in Europe.

With 68 million euros raised to date and recently recognised in the Next40 list as one of the top 40 French tech startups with the most potential, we continue to build on our unique ecosystem that brings together a range of businesses, as well as schools and universities, around the next generation, giving them the tools they need to launch their working careers with confidence.

To support our growth in Europe, we are currently looking for people who want to evolve in a fast-growing company, with a start-up spirit and labeled Great Place to Work.



Job Description

What will be your mission ? 🦸‍♀️ 🦸‍♂️

 

We are looking for a Senior Product Designer (CDI), join us !

 

You will be part of the Product Team in the tribe dedicated to students and universities made up of talented people.

Within a squad, you will work closely with your Product Manager and Software Engineers, involved in all design aspects, from discovery to delivery. 

As an active member of the Design Team, you will also collaborate with other designers for a seamless and unified experience. 

 

Your daily life :

  • In tandem with the Product Manager, you will frame what you need to build and how to get there. 
  • You structure the discovery process to bring to light user problems, define and prioritize the right opportunities for your squad objectives (OKR methodology) on great autonomy
  • You are a real support on user research by preparing appropriate interviews and delivering the findings
  • You will design optimal and easy-to-use solutions to answer to user problems using our Design System, and validate them through usability testing
  • You will pay attention to the quality of the delivery
  • You will participate on monitoring the impact of the solutions on objectives and user experience
  • You will stay close to the Design Team thanks to our weekly routines (Design Critics, peers sharing, …)

 



Qualifications

Who are you? 🎯

 

  • The position of product designer requires a profile of 70% UR/UX and 30% UI.
  • 4+ years experience in a company with a strong product design practice (scale-up, GAFA, ESN or top agency).
  • You have a great capacity to listen and to take a step back.
  • You know how to embrace complexity and then simplify.
  • You are willing to learn on a daily basis.
  • Fluent in English and French.



Additional Information

8 reasons why (to join us) : 

 

💚 A meaningful mission with a concrete impact on the new generation

🌏 An international team with strong values 

🚀 A challenging environment to grow in and real evolution perspectives 

🏡 A super flexible remote policy (possibility to work remotely 4 days a week + 1 month a year wherever you want in Europe) 

🏢 A beautiful office in Paris (IXe) (only for French contracts, adapt to the location)

👩‍💻 A top Apple equipment : Macbook Air and Iphone 11

🎬 An attractive corporate life : charity actions, sport challenges, parties, business case, seminars, etc.! 

💸 An advantageous remuneration package, between 8 and 13 RRT/year, Alan as “mutuelle”, a Swile Card, 50% of your public transportation reimbursed, BSPCE, etc.   

...We could continue, but let’s discuss the topic together during the recruitment process! 

 

We are an inclusive company 

At JobTeaser, we are dedicated to creating a work environment where everyone feels great and we are proud to promote diversity within our teams. All applications we receive are reviewed through a defined process based on skills. 

 

What’s next? 

  1. A first call with, Sandra, Talent Acquisition Specialist (HR team) and a 30-min screening call with a member of the team to get to know you better 

  2. A focus interview : a 100% live case in 2 hours (no extra time at home) to test your hard skills

  3. An interview with your future manager, Marie-Eve, Lead Product Designer, to discuss about your past experiences and motivations

  4. A final round with Maud, HR Manager and  Arthur, Chief Product Officer to confirm the reciprocal match

  5. Welcome at JobTeaser!! 

Don’t worry: the process can be very quick despite the different steps! (2-3 weeks in average)⏱

title: Customer Success Manager, Pharmacy
description:

title: Senior Engineer in Test (f/m/d)
description:
We are looking for fintech enthusiasts to join us in creating the financial infrastructure of tomorrow. We are building the first European Investment API Platform to enable any financial institution to offer a broad range of investment products in their apps. Our view is backed by Europe's largest tech VCs (Earlybird, Notion Capital, ABN Ventures, Partech, HV Capital) and by renowned fintech entrepreneurs (including Maximilian Tayenthal, founder of N26, and Felix Haas, founder of IDnow).

 

We’re based in Berlin but would consider hiring remotely for this role. If you do want to move to Berlin though, we’re happy to support your relocation.

 

At Upvest, our vision is to make investing as easy as spending money. By enabling any business to offer investment opportunities, our goal is to empower anyone to invest. Today, we count 50+ talented people from 20 different countries.
 

Engineer in Test role

This is a brand-new role at Upvest Engineering. It will be a chance to come in, make the role your own, and potentially the start of a whole new team. We do not believe in silos and as such are not looking for traditional Quality Assurance (QA) folks but rather Engineers in Test. People who are developers at heart but focus on quality and testing aspects of the work. Therefore, a successful candidate would also need to be able to work with our Go codebase hands-on. This is not an average quality assurance role.

 

Your mission:

As a Senior Engineer in Test, you will join and take ownership of driving the quality mindset into our product engineering teams. You will collaborate with teams in setting up best practices, good test coverage and help them in automating testing processes. You will foster a culture of quality and security first, helping teams in building services that are loosely coupled, robust and resilient, secure, and observable but most of all testable and maintainable. You have a supportive and coaching attitude towards working with other engineers. You are a developer yourself. The goal is to have enough safety net for teams to be able to move to a continuous delivery model and be confident that all areas of functionality are covered, and even unexpected errors do not get missed. This is a role not belonging to any specific Product Engineering team but works on the department level collaborating with all teams. The role reports directly to the CTO (or a relevant Head of Engineering). You will be working on a greenfield project with cutting-edge technologies and no legacy code.

This role will give you the opportunity to:

  • Help build a modern Cloud native investment bank and API-platform

  • Gain valuable experience in a high-security, high-stakes and high-growth FinTech environment

  • Hands-on experience in testing at all levels from unit testing thru integration testing to end-to-end testing.

  • Hands-on developer experience at Senior level. Industry experience for 5+ years.

  • Good analytical skills and the ability to grasp a complex distributed system and its overall functionality. Ability to see the big picture.

  • Good people and communication skills

  • Planning and prioritization skills. Focus on what matters.

  • Stakeholder management skills. Ability to discuss difficult technical topics with non-technical stakeholders.

  • Taking ownership and owning the outcome

  • Prior experience with event-driven distributed systems

  • Prior experience with Cloud computing (ideally with GCP)

  • An understanding of security best practices and how they apply to software testing

  • High level of pragmatism.

 

Nice to have:

  • Experience working in the FinTech domain

  • Knowledge of our modern tech-stack (Go, Docker, K8S, LinkerD, Postgres, Kafka), SRE, service meshes, API gateways, and observability.

 

Why Upvest?

  • We are working on solving a hard problem: fixing the European securities financial infrastructure that empowers more people to be able to invest. You have the opportunity to contribute to this change.

  • We invest in you. From access to a personal coach, development budget and plenty of opportunities to grow in your role.

  • We take hiring seriously with a strong focus on keeping a high bar when interviewing (equally important is that we also hire decent people who are passionate about their craft and helping us achieve our shared mission).

  • While we are not fully remote, we are committed to being a flexible employer as we understand you do not have to be in the office to do your best work.

  • We live a culture of empowerment, trust (that we hire the best people and get out of their way) and openness (there is a greater advantage in sharing information than keeping it to ourselves).

  • We ensure we take time to have fun as a team. We are looking forward to having more time in-person again once this becomes possible again.

  • Everyone is an owner. Every employee becomes a part owner via our options program. We want to ensure that if the company does well, everyone who has been a part of making it happen will also enjoy the success.

 

 

Our values:

  • Learn and grow: We aim high to shape our future. We give and request honest feedback. Everything is a learning opportunity. Progression > Perfection.

  • Team first. We make it easy for others. We value different views, disagree, and commit. We win and celebrate together!

  • Own the outcome. We are proactive and finish the job until it is done. Happy clients > Sales. We take breaks when needed.

  • Tell the story. We always start with the ‘why’. Outcome > Process. We share knowledge to empower others.

title: Growth Marketing Manager
description:
Are you excited by the idea of working somewhere that’s stimulating and friendly with countless opportunities for growth and plenty of freedom to make a real impact? This could be the place for you!

We are looking for a Growth Marketing Manager here at INSHUR, based in NYC pre-pandemic, and currently 100% remote but working in the EST timezone. You’ll be working on re-inventing insurance in exciting markets across multiple territories, including the US, UK, and the Netherlands, and new European countries and US states as we expand.

Supported by (and reporting to) the Head of Growth Marketing, you'll be joining a friendly team of 6 marketeers who believe in accelerating the growth of INSHUR worldwide by making INSHUR the go-to brand and provider of choice for commercial auto insurance.

We’ve got a great team in place and are a people & culture-first business (check out our Glassdoor reviews). We value high performance and care deeply about making INSHUR feel like a place where everyone is building something really special, that we can all be proud of, and doing it with friends.

What you'll do

You will be responsible for leading the B2C marketing activity for some of our markets globally, with an initial focus on NYC and our US market, developing a marketing plan and strategy, identifying target audiences, key messages and campaign themes; creating and executing the marketing activity and delivering KPIs across the marketing funnel. As a martech enthusiast who loves experimenting with new marketing tools and techniques and has a sharp eye for data, you will take charge of defining, launching and running marketing activities and campaigns across a variety of channels and for delivering ambitious leads targets. The role could also include some line-management opportunities as the team is expanding.

At INSHUR, we work in an agile and collaborative way. You will be an integral part and stakeholder of the growth teams for dedicated markets, acting as the main marketing lead.

Below is a list of skills that we think would make you successful in this role.

We'd love to hear from you if you:

  • Have a strong track record with many years in consumer marketing roles with a focus on customer acquisition (digital and direct response marketing) and demonstrable experience of delivering commercial targets and acquiring customers throughout the marketing funnel
  • Are commercially savvy, with a restless curiosity for campaign performance. Your are continuously striving to understand how to improve channel performance attribution and optimising marketing spend and are comfortable with KPIs reporting with proficient knowledge of Google Analytics and other marketing tools
  • Are a marketing campaign expert who has lead consumer campaigns across a range of online and offline channels (owned, earned and paid); briefing and managing agencies, delivering creatives, launching and tracking campaigns
  • Are comfortable with paid channels (PPC, Social, Display, OOH, Radio, affiliates, etc.) in the B2C space
  • Love to roll up your sleeves, and enjoy managing a wide range of marketing tactics and experiments on your own with a focus on achieving tangible commercial targets

Your colleagues say you are:

  • A go-getter who is resourceful, continuously seeks to learn new skills and find creative solutions to problems
  • Someone with a solid strategic mindset, strong organisational skills and an aptitude to approach things methodically but also super comfortable with ambiguity
  • Very hands-on and happy to roll up your sleeves and get stuck in to deliver results
  • A brilliant story-teller with an eye for creative expression and good copy-writing skills
  • Passionate with high energy and drive

What we offer

We provide a friendly and stimulating environment for everyone to grow, learn and thrive in. We operate in a hybrid of remote and office-based work and we encourage a flexible way of working to adapt to personal circumstances and individual and business needs.

In terms of salary, your previous experience and expertise will be taken into account when agreeing on the final offer.

We offer all our employees stock options and we've built a benefits package that invests in our employees’ long-term personal and professional growth and well-being. Here’s a sample of what this includes:

  • 30 days of holiday annually in addition to 8 federal holidays and statutory sick leave
  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • Basic Life, short-term, and long-term disability insurance
  • 401K match
  • 13 weeks full pay parental leave regardless of your gender
  • Flexibility to choose your place of work (East Coast US only) and flexible working hours
  • Annual training allowance of $1300 (no questions asked) and regular learning opportunities
  • Commuter benefits
  • Monthly flexible well-being allowance to help you remain healthy and productive
  • And much more…

It goes without saying that we provide everyone with a laptop, monitor, top of the range kit, and any software you need.

Where possible, we will cross-train and/or focus on what interests you, whether it’s marketing technology, creative design or brand strategy.

About Us

We have recently completed a successful Series B funding, which will fuel our ambitious growth plans and enable us to invest in technology, recruit the best people, and bring new insurtech product lines to the market while keeping us at the forefront of urban mobility. With a mission to make insurance fair & easy for everyone, we are committed to changing the way customers buy and feel about insurance, for good.

As a global team of around 150 people based in the USA, UK, and the Netherlands, we value:

  • Generosity, inclusivity, open-mindedness, and diversity
  • The delivery of great results and learning in the open
  • Freedom to make long-term, high-impact decisions
  • The well-being of their teammates and the people around them
  • Enjoying the ride


Founded in 2016, we are one of the fastest-growing and commercially proven Insurtech companies in the new insurance landscape. Working closely with globally recognized partners, we provide fully digital auto insurance for taxi, TLC, ride-share, delivery, private fleet, and private hire drivers, enabling them to get from a quote to a full policy cover in the shortest possible time. Our products are currently live in the US, UK, and the Netherlands and we have exciting plans to expand to new territories and add new product lines.

We are based in and around the NYC area but currently work 100% remotely. Post-pandemic we may consider transitioning to a hybrid office and home-based model with travel to co-working spaces for in-person meetings at least once a quarter.

Equal opportunities

We believe that having a diverse team where everyone can be their authentic self is the key to our success. We are passionate about equal opportunities and improving the tech industry for the better, so we encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply. We don't discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, marital status, disability, or age. Our offices, when open, are child-friendly and fully wheelchair-accessible.

While this position is advertised as full-time, we are flexible on the specific arrangements for the right candidate and would be happy to discuss part-time, job-share, or other flexible arrangements, if required. Let us know in your application if you have accessibility requirements for your interview and we will do our best to accommodate.

title: Director of Customer Success
description:
About DocStation

DocStation is a care management platform that connects pharmacists and payers to improve patient outcomes. We’re looking for a self-motivated leader to join our team who shares our passion for transforming the $3 trillion healthcare industry.

About the role

DocStation’s pharmacy network spans everything from small, local, independent pharmacies to large national chains. Our pharmacies perform clinical work in a variety of programs which are largely dependent on their region. In this role, you will help guide and establish the teams responsible for implementation, success and support of our pharmacies and providing the best customer experience possible.

When you first get started, your role will be a player-coach as you learn the business and help your team deliver on key success metrics through improving operational processes, coaching and mentoring, asset creation, or other identified needs. As you get ramped up over the next 12 months, you will be expected to make a plan for growth and hire the team around you to further refine and scale services to our customers.

What you’ll do

  • Identify operational needs and implement efficient processes to ensure high pharmacy engagement with DocStation
  • Develop, report on, and drive improvement of key performance indicators for pharmacy success and support
  • Lead, coach, and mentor your teams to deliver a best-in-class customer experience
  • Work closely with internal teams to communicate customer needs and opportunities

What you’ll bring to DocStation

  • Demonstrated success building and leading customer-facing teams of a SaaS product
  • Hands-on operational experience and motivation to develop efficient processes with tools like HubSpot and Intercom for complex onboarding and educational needs
  • Strong empathy for customers AND a passion for revenue and growth
  • Experience leveraging data and analytics in decision making

Company benefits

  • Fully distributed company—work from anywhere in the US you're most comfortable
  • In-person team retreats & outings (previous locations include Big Sky, MT, Boulder, CO, and Sundance, Utah)
  • Competitive pay and equity
  • Great health benefits for you and family
  • Equipment you need to do your job, including a home office stipend
  • Annual education allowance
  • Monthly self-care allowance

One more thing

We're looking for people with passion, grit, and an overall desire to do good work that helps people. You're encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description. Your skills and passion will stand out—and set you apart—especially if your career has taken some extraordinary twists and turns. We welcome people who want to change the status quo, have a chip on their shoulder, and are willing to fight for what they believe in.

How to apply

As a fully remote company, we highly value the ability to communicate in writing. Please submit your application with a highly detailed cover letter that describes why you believe you're a good fit for this particular position and anything else you'd like us to know. When answering the additional questions, please go into detail (we also love to read).


DocStation is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Associate Writer - Healthcare
description:
A bit about us: 
 
We’re on a mission to change healthcare — how it’s paid for, delivered, experienced. We want to put people center stage, not process or profit. We are guided by a deep belief that every person on Medicare should be treated like we would treat a member of our own family: with loving care and a profound commitment to their health and well-being. 
 
That’s why we’re gathering a whole bunch of smart, big-hearted people to create a new kind of healthcare company — one that combines compassion, health insurance, clinical care, and technology seamlessly. 
 
"We want to partner with people we love for a cause we believe in. Life is short. Join us."
 
 
About this role:
 
Do you like to write? Devoted Health is looking for an associate writer to develop a wide assortment of articles, helpful resources, and content assets to engage and educate older Americans.
 
In this role, you’ll write everything from articles, webinars, tutorials, letters, website copy, and more—all with a health and wellbeing focus. You don’t need to have a background in healthcare or Medicare to apply, but you should have a journalist’s love of researching new topics and writing about them in a way that’s clear, compelling, and meets our audience where they are.
 
The ideal candidate is interested in working in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. You’re a curious self-starter who’s unafraid to ask questions. You’re open to digging into new topics and technologies and becoming a subject matter expert. You love obsessing over the little details—like word choice and punctuation—but you can also work fast and pivot quickly when priorities change. 



Responsibilities will include:
  • Researching and writing long-form articles on health, wellness, financial resources
  • Creating easy-to-understand guides and tip sheets 
  • Writing content that’s in our brand voice and aligns with our overall brand strategy
  • Editing and de-jargoning emails, letters, forms, and regulatory documents
  • Working alongside designers to make sure your copy sings in layout 
  • Establishing relationships with in-house subject matter experts to guarantee our materials are accurate and helpful
  • Work with team members on various initiatives to improve the engagement and impact of content



Desired skills and experience:
  • Preferably 1-3 years of experience writing for a brand or news site
  • Bachelor’s degree in English, journalism, or a similar field
  • Interest in a very fast-paced or startup environment 
  • History of success in working with a team and on deadline
  • Ability to research and write about complex topics
  • Strong grasp of English language and grammar
  • Excellent organizational and communication skills
  • A can-do attitude 
  • Portfolio and cover letter required
  • Healthcare background a plus, but not required
#LI-EM1
#LI-REMOTE
 
If you love running towards complex challenges and transforming them into solutions, if you want to make a potentially huge impact on many lives, and if you are looking for a disruptive startup with an inspiring and talented team, Devoted Health may be the place for you!  If you lack a specific credential for this position but believe that your strengths and life experiences will propel our mission, we would love to hear from you.
 
Devoted is an equal opportunity employer.  We are committed to a safe and supportive work environment in which all employees have the opportunity to participate and contribute to the success of the business. We value diversity and collaboration. Individuals are respected for their skills, experience, and unique perspectives. This commitment is embodied in Devoted’s Code of Conduct, our company values and the way we do business.
 
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, the Company does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy status, marital status, national origin, disability, age, sexual orientation, veteran status, genetic information, gender identity, gender expression, or any other factor prohibited by law. Our management team is dedicated to this policy with respect to recruitment, hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, training, compensation, benefits, employee activities and general treatment during employment.
 
COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement: Where permitted by applicable law, candidates must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered. The Company will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified employees with disabilities or for a sincerely held religious belief, practice, or observance.

title: Senior Front-end Engineer (ReactJS)
description:
Pennylane is building the financial OS (Operating System) for European SMEs. A single source of truth for financial data, used on one side by entrepreneurs to run their business (invoicing and getting paid, paying suppliers and expense management, piloting cash and profitability) and on the other side by their accountant for bookkeeping and fiscal declarations.
 
Saving time to all entrepreneurs and accountants, helping them to make the right decisions and enabling 3rd parties to offer added-value personalized financial services.
 
We’ve launched in France and will expand to other markets in Continental Europe in 2022. Our commercial website is thus in French only but the code is obviously documented in English and our tech team speaks English.
 
We’re product-led, growing fast, backed by strong investors and are starting to hire software engineers anywhere in Europe, to join our experienced remote-first engineering team.
 
 
🎯 Your mission
 
In a word : build the best financial management and accounting software for continental Europe and change the life of entrepreneurs and their accountants.
 
In more details :
 
- Join one of our product squads and work with a Product Manager, a Product Designer, a Data Scientist and other experienced Software Engineers
- Product-led company with decentralized decision-making and strong ownership of each Product Squad
- The product we build is used on a daily basis by our customers and partners and you’ll have a strong impact and great feedback loop
 
🏠 Offices
 
The company in based in Paris, but the whole Tech team is working remotely. You are thus free to work from wherever you want in Europe.
 
✨ What's exciting about our project ?
    • The vision : We want to change the life of thousands of entrepreneurs throughout Europe with our solution
    • The ambition : We are scaling at a very rapid pace and we want to become one of the fintech leaders within 2-3 years
    • The learning curve : We have great tech mentors and experienced engineers whom you can share with and learn from everyday
    • The environment : We do our best to develop a culture based on trust, autonomy, and benevolence so you can feel like you're in the right place
🥇 You’re the right candidate if…
    • You have experience with React (at least 4 years)
    • You’re a teamplayer and have experience working in an agile environment
    • You like being challenged and solving complex problems (accounting is complex in Europe)
    • You have empathy for your users and want to change their lives
    • You have an engineering background
🎁 What we offer
    • A competitive package + Company shares
    • Great health benefits
    • Apple Hardware
    • Budget to work from a coworking space or buy equipment to work from home
    • Monthly remote events, and one offsite with the whole company once a year
    • Career tracks to make sure you can keep learning and growing within Pennylane.
🤝Hiring process
  • A first interview with our Talent Acquisition Manager
  • A technical test 
  • An interview with one of our tech cofounders debriefing your technical test and assessing cultural fit

title: Logistics Coordinator, Transportation
description:
Olaplex is revolutionizing the haircare industry through a patented, proprietary technology that protects and repairs hair from damage. We’ve paved the way for a completely new category of hair care and, due to an overwhelming support from the brand’s loyal stylist and advocate base, the company has emerged as one of the largest independent hair care brands in the world.

Olaplex has been able to achieve phenomenal growth and we continuously seek exceptionally talented individuals who can support our innovation and creativity. We currently operate in a fully remote environment; because of this, collaboration and flexibility are at the core of our commitment to each other and to the success of Olaplex.

The Coordinator of Logistics supports the execution of day-to-day logistics operations to maintain efficient movement of inventory between Olaplex’s seven global warehouses, contract manufacturers and vendors. They monitor operations, provide shipment visibility and support the implementation of logistics processes to improve service and reduce costs.

Responsibilities:

  • Partner with 3PL teams on booking, monitoring of Inbound and Outbound ocean container shipments and communication of shipment reporting.  
  • Assist in the flow of inventory by monitoring 3PL shipment accuracy, availability, documentation accuracy and reporting.  
  • Review and track Logistics invoices. Perform periodic invoice audits to ensure accuracy of charges against standard and budget.
  • Review new customer’s guides to ensure all shipping requirements are identified and can be met. Partner with teams to develop standard operating procedures for each customer.
  • Manage execution, monitoring, reporting of transfer orders and complete inventory receipts in NetSuite.
  • Assist with process development to analyze and evaluate 3PL performance metrics.   
  • Partner with 3PL / customers on transportation claim submissions and resolutions.
  • Assist with month end accruals.  
  • Partner with the Customer Support, Transportation, Procurement and eCommerce teams to plan and prioritize logistics activities.  Assist with resolution of any service issues related to logistics operations.
  • Assist with coordination of 3PL special projects.
  • Periodically visit 3PL locations to inspect operations.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree preferred - in Business/Logistics/Distribution.
  • 2+ years of related supply chain experience (Logistics, Warehousing, or Distribution) in a CPG environment with experience managing 3PL.
  • Strong Excel skills required. Experience with NetSuite preferred.
  • Able to consider the impacts of decisions on the customer, ensuring that any changes will improve and elevate the customer experience.
  • Organized with the ability to balance multiple priorities at once and manage time appropriately.
  • Detail-oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong and effective written and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Ability to work cohesively with multiple teams and build strong relationships with our internal and external partners.

Benefits:

  • Work/Life Balance: Remote work environment, unlimited time off, 11 paid holidays, and flexible work schedules.
  • Wellness: Medical, dental, and vision insurance for employees in addition to short- and long-term disability coverage and life insurance.
  • Financial Well-being: Roth and 401k plans.
  • Products: Fourteen (14) free products per year, plus a friends and family discount.
  • Culture: Our team has an “attitude of gratitude” and a shared passion for our brand. We are a fast-paced, high-growth company where career opportunities can be endless.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:

At Olaplex, we support and stand up for our community with our talent, content, messages, and product offering. We strive to build and nurture a culture where a focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion is instinctive. Our deep sense of passion and pride in what we do, both as individuals and as a company, unifies our shared commitment to 'do well and do good'. We recognize and celebrate different ideas, perspectives, and backgrounds and know they create a stronger and more creative work environment.

title: People Operations Specialist
description:
Air Apps' team is hiring highly motivated teammates to help build, maintain and market our mobile applications. We are a 100% remote company with just over 18 employees working across the globe every single day to build products that enrich people's lives. We combine the simplicity and greatness of Apple products by creating utility and productivity apps that make people's lives easier. Our portfolio contains Translate Now & Calculator Air, both the fastest-growing apps in their category. Our apps have been downloaded over 50 million times and received over 2 million ratings with an average of 4.6 stars.

 

Mission

At Air Apps, we intend to make people's life easier by offering software solutions that allow people to perform their daily activities in work, social, fitness, and learning right from their mobile devices.

About the role

The Global People Operations Coordinator puts the employee first by humanizing impersonal systems and continuously improving employee engagement, development, and retention. As part of the People Operations team, you'll enjoy an engaging and fast-paced environment, with opportunities to contribute to the growth of the air apps brand.

Responsibilities
  • Assist in managing the employee journey.
  • Proactively creates new systems and programs to improve ways of working.
  • Support the current workforce so that there is less turnover.
  • Provide onboarding and offboarding support for team members and will often work alongside other teams.
  • Assist in the recruiting and hiring process for the company.
  • Process employee changes and terminations, including document generation, notifications, and HR systems updates.
  • Support employees on a day-to-day basis and answer questions about benefits and company policies
  • Assist in planning and implementing team events
  • Complete ad-hoc projects, reporting, and tasks
Expected daily activities
  • Respond quickly and effectively to time-sensitive employee issues
  • Create projects focused on enhancing the employee experience
  • Properly manage and document all work performed.
Your opportunity

We offer a fully remote, results-driven work style that enhances productivity and quality, providing excellent work-life balance. We also have great opportunities to connect within our international team through coffee calls, team meetings, and hackathons.

  • Proven startup with significant ambitions
  • Highly competitive salary and bonuses
  • Flexible work environment, 100% remote
  • Apple hardware environment
  • USD100.00 Monthly allowance (Home office, Learning, Wellness)
  • USD350.00 Home office set up
  • Retreats - We plan to hold a yearly get together (COVID19 - when safe again)
Statutory benefits
  • Health insurance (or your country's standard)
  • 24 Annual vacation days (or your country's standard)
  • 4 weeks sick leave (or your country's standard)
  • 4 weeks parental leave (or your country's standard)
  • National holidays (or your country's standard)
  • 40 Hours work-week (or your country's standard)
  • Plus any other statutory benefit in your country

You are passionate about building world-class software. You aspire to join an energetic team in a fast-growing startup to build and grow products at scale. Your desired skills and experience include:

  • Proficient in English
  • 3+ years of professional experience in People Operations in the EU and some experience globally
  • Believe in an empathetic and modern approach to People Operations.
  • Excellent knowledge of Lattice, Slack, Google Docs, and other communication channels;
  • Self-starting, self-motivated, self-directed, and self-sufficient
  • Be up to date with the latest People Operations trends, benefits, and needs
  • Enthusiasm for finding the cause of any issues our staff and company face and help quickly resolve or provide a solution.
  • BA in Human Resources or equivalent industry experience
Teamwork

The job requires operating in small teams, in a highly dynamic and remote environment. Working remote means that you need to, at least, manage one person - yourself. You must be able to, including but not limited to:

  • Work effectively with multi-functional and international teams
  • Work highly collaborative, without any micro-management necessary
  • Use Slack and other remote communication/reporting tools
  • Implement and structure a remote working routine
  • Discipline and manage yourself
  • Communicate heavily about statuses and issues
  • Combine work and life in a healthy and productive flow
  • Juggle multiple projects at the same time
  • Work agile and fast, very fast
  • Receive and provide constructive feedback
  • Embrace changes
  • Find the needle in the haystack and solve problems methodically

 

What Happens Next?

We expect to review your application ASAP. You'll hear from us within 2-3 days if we decide to invite you to a technical exercise. The exercise is representative of the kind of day-to-day work you'd be doing on the team. We usually only invite candidates to this stage that meet minimum standards, and those candidates should expect to spend about 2-3 hours completing this test.

The next phase of the hiring process will be a video interview with our people operations manager (approx. 30 min). You and she will talk through your background and your approach to remote, teamwork and Air Apps. After the people interview, the top candidates will proceed to the team interview stage. You'll talk with 1-2 members of the team about your technical knowledge, experience and discuss the position (approx. 1h).

The top candidates will proceed to the final interview stage. You'll talk to the leadership team and will align yours and the company's expectations. We aim to make an offer 3-5 days after your final interview.

Please note that we're unable to offer individual feedback during the process. We usually see 1,000+ applications, and our team can't provide personalized feedback. It is a demanding application process. We appreciate you giving us that consideration, and we promise to provide you with our full attention in return. We look forward to hearing from you!

 

Disclaimer

This position is fully REMOTE, no re-allocation or visa sponsorship is provided. You will be able to work from anywhere; however, you will be hired in your legal country of residency.

title: Senior Director, Data & Analytics
description:
About Dodge Construction Network:

Dodge Construction Network leverages an unmatched offering of data, analytics, and industry-spanning relationships to generate the most powerful source of information, knowledge, insights, and connections in the commercial construction industry. The company powers four longstanding and trusted industry solutions—Dodge Data & Analytics, The Blue Book Network, Sweets, and IMS—to connect the dots across the entire commercial construction ecosystem. Together, these solutions provide clear and actionable opportunities for both small teams and enterprise firms. Purpose-built to simplify the complex, Dodge Construction Network ensures that construction professionals have the information they need to build successful businesses and thriving communities. With over a century of industry experience, Dodge Construction Network is the catalyst for modern commercial construction.

To learn more, visit: construction.com

About the Role:

Are you passionate about changing the trajectory of the Commercial Construction market by deploying world-class digital and data science products and platforms that impact a $1T industry ripe for change?

Are you a product leader who wants to shape the data products and capabilities for a leader in Commercial Construction data, blending customer intimacy, user-centricity, and business outcomes?

Analytics and data science are a key focus of everything we do at Dodge Construction Network (DCN). We are modernizing our core data platforms, increasing visibility, and investing in scalable and reusable data science platforms and products built on our modern digital stack, to unlock new predictive/prescriptive insights that leverage the strength of our industry-leading data network.

We are searching for a Senior Director, Data & Analytics. The position can be remote. As the Senior Director, Data & Analytics you will be responsible for partnering closely with the product and data platforms leaders to define, prioritize, and deploy the portfolio of use cases that can be solved at scale by leveraging different digital and data science platforms.

You will shape and lead the discussions to create a capability-suite that enables transformative value for our customers and business. You will define and evangelize the data science and visualization product vision, strategy, and roadmap that are closely aligned with business strategy and priorities. You will work closely with the product engineering team to productize innovative practices and tools that help organizations transform their operations and increase their velocity.

You will also create and nurture strong collaboration with key internal and external stakeholders. Collaborating with our partners, other product leaders, and the product engineering team, you will bring some of the most innovative never-been-done-before capabilities to DCN.

What you'll do:

  • Define data science and visualization product vision, strategy, and build short / long term roadmap to enable transformative value in the Commercial Construction market.
  • Lead and grow a strong team of DS&A product managers, continuously raising the bar on performance, technical depth, product management results, and people leadership skills.
  • Partner closely with business leaders to drive alignment on digital and data science strategy, priorities, deployment roadmap.
  • Define and lead high-impact digital and data science portfolio of use cases (“Book of Work”), deploy and scale the advanced products and platforms in partnership with other product leaders and the product engineering team,
  • Develop a deep understanding and empathy of the customer and stakeholder landscape.
  • Build the voice of the users into product features. Own and drive the digital and data science product lifecycle from envision to deploy and operate
  • Partner with business team to identify new opportunities, gather requirements, develop, and activate business cases.
  • Champion and drive large strategic and complex projects, with executive visibility and many critical dependencies
  • Define and build your own scorecard to continuously monitor and analyze roadmap durability, backlog health, velocity, quality, throughput, product performance and use the data to drive improvements
  • Proactively and effectively communicate product strategy, roadmap, deployment status, value realization, and portfolio results with senior management.
  • Create and nurture partnerships and alliances to expand our product footprint and speed up time-to-market for customers.

What you'll bring:

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Business, Technology, Computer Science with a focus on data science / advanced analytics / AI / Machine Learning, or related field. MBA or Advanced degree in these fields is preferred.
  • 8+ years of experience as a data/data science product management leader with a focus on stakeholder management, product strategy, prioritizing the use cases with business, and galvanizing the organization is required.
  • Solid understanding of how to create actionable insights and use cases that can unlock significant value in terms of strengthening relationships, transforming customer experiences, generating cost-saving, revenue lift, capex reduction, and margin improvement
  • Proven ability to work cross-functionally and build partnerships to deliver results and influence
  • Proven track record of innovation and launching digital and data/data science products that achieve success and impact
  • Proven ability to drive, manage, and influence multiple, competing priorities and projects in a fast-paced environment where continuous innovation is desired
  • Demonstrated ability to develop business cases and track business benefits, including calculating return on investment (ROI), P&L savings, cash flow impact, and other key business metrics in supply chain
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to simplify complex topics for broad audiences across levels. Data-driven decision making and quantitative analysis skills
  • Familiar with machine learning, AI, advanced analytics, and visualization applications
  • Ability to manage senior, high performing staff
  • Energetic, self-driven, passionate, accountable, keen on continuous learning
  • Experience working in the Commercial Construction market is a plus.

As a federal contractor and sub-contractor, Dodge Construction Network (DCN) is required to comply with Executive Order # 14042. This mandate requires all of our US-based DCN team members to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or have an approved exemption due to medical need or a sincerely held religious belief. We welcome candidate questions about this requirement.

We are committed to leveraging the talent of a diverse workforce to create great opportunities for our business and our people. EOE/AA. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran

title: Director of Product
description:
Who We Are

Open Up Resources is a publisher of high-quality open educational resources in core content areas, with a vision of providing teachers with the tools to engage students in liberating educational experiences.

Open Up Resources’ portfolio seeks to include the highest-quality, standards-based PK-12 curricula, with validation from respected third-party entities, evidence of efficacy, effective supports for multilingual learners, inclusive strategies for students with disabilities, embedded culturally relevant pedagogy, and professional learning that is inclusive and culturally considerate.

We are transforming instructional materials through our commitment to anti-racism. This intentional commitment infuses every program, partnership, and practice. Our desire is that Open Up Resources' curricula catalyzes anti-racist norms, structures, practices, and policies in education and society.


The Role

This position will direct the product strategy for curriculum offered by Open Up, which includes new product development for print and digital delivery. Translating the business strategy from our leadership team into execution-ready product strategy, this position will partner across the organization to achieve our vision cohesively and effectively. The Director of Product will serve as a key leader driving our product strategy, from roadmap to launch, and will ensure the ongoing quality and impact of our curriculum products and services.


Key Responsibilities

  • Work with Open Up Resources' Chief Operating Officer and MD of Product Engineering to outline print and digital product strategy, effectively prioritizing efforts across initiatives, teams, functions, and external partnerships.
  • Identify methods to bring innovative instructional programs to life, resulting in higher quality teaching and learning experiences.
  • Spearhead research into emerging areas of anti-racist and culturally relevant product design, software development, and curriculum delivery in partnership with the CAO, COO, and MD.
  • Identify trends and growth areas in the PK–12 education space to be utilized in identifying growth areas for Open Up Rsource’s current and future products.
  • Maintain a deep understanding of educators’ pain points and deliver solutions that drive growth and customer retention.
  • Work with the Open Up Resources Academics team content experts to ensure instructional intent is upheld in final products.
  • Identify key measures of success, set expectations with all relevant stakeholders, and regularly report on these KPIs
  • Work closely with Engineering and Sr. Product Managers across the full product life cycle, from user research to requirements refinement to prototyping to production.
  • Collaborate with Sr. Product Managers to see feature development through from concept to launch, from post launch analysis to ongoing optimization.
  • Collaborate to ensure all product development and revision efforts are aligned with and driven by overall product strategy.


Position Core Competencies
Ethics and Integrity: Behave in a fair and ethical manner toward peers, partners, and customers; instill mutual trust and confidence; act with honesty and integrity.

Business Skills and Knowledge: Demonstrate a solid literacy in areas related to OUR’s business and curriculum products; able to design and develop organizational strategies to align performance with business needs or desired results.

Planning/Organizing/Goal Setting: Demonstrates the ability to organize people and tasks; develops realistic action plans while being sensitive to time constraints and resource availability; defines realistic, specific goals and objectives; prioritizes objectives.

Teamwork and Collaboration: Work with colleagues to build morale and team commitment to goals and objectives. Cultivates a positive partner and customer service relationship, and fosters two-way communication; delivers products that exceeds or meets customer expectations.

Diversity: Understands that each individual is unique and celebrates individual differences including race/ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, age, mental or physical disability, marital status, veteran status, education, training, position, level of authority, seniority, full-time or part-time status.

Continuous Improvement: Continuously seek opportunities for innovative approaches to address organizational opportunities supporting strategic initiatives.

Solution Oriented: Able to take action in solving problems, using reason and a systematic approach.

Managing Change: Embrace an environment nimble to change, both internally and externally, in response to adjusting business needs, educational ecosystem and/or strategic shifts to meet the mission.


Requirements


  • 7+ years of experience in product leadership, including hands-on prioritization and requirement specification.
  • 5+ years of professional experience specifically in the areas of curriculum development and instructional design.
  • Deep familiarity with long-term and short-term trends in K-12 education in and out of the classroom.
  • Solid understanding of the extension of curriculum content to both print and digital applications.
  • Demonstrated data-centric and listening-led leadership, with confidence to dive deep into product performance metrics and to seek insight from user research.
  • Passion for building great products and commitment to growing and developing a team while collaborating in cross-team environments.
  • Excellent communication, time management, conceptual, organizational, and analytical skills.

Benefits

Additional Details

  • At Open Up Resources, we believe in building and fostering a diverse, inclusive and anti-racist remote workplace environment. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer where all applicants are considered for employment without attention to color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.
  • We are seeking candidates who have lived experiences related to social justice, diversity, equity, and inclusion.
  • We are a virtual organization with headquarters in the California Bay Area.
  • We offer competitive compensation and generous benefits packages.

title: Squarespace Designer/Developer
description:
The City-State of DBC endeavors to reduce the noisy world of brand marketing. Building and maintaining visual identities, strategic planning of brand launches, and everyday brand messaging creates quite the vivid world of communication between the team and our citizens. We craft authentic brands through a mix of all creative fields, deploying data-driven strategies that will resonate with today's ever-evolving audience. Our citizens are a mix of enterprise for-profit and national non-profits, as well as early stage companies who deserve the benefit of high level work.
As you can imagine, our citizens strategy involves website design. A strategy to save citizen money is by building easy to manage websites on the Squarespace Platform. Thus, we need a:
Squarespace Designer + Developer

The mission of DBC is to Reduce the Noise. In order to help our citizens communicate directly with their target audiences, we need to produce effective creative that achieves our shared goals. We need to move quickly, and measure our success to keep citizens satisfied and loyal. Your job will be to create amazing and effective websites for citizens on the Squarespace Platform. We'll know if you've succeeded the websites launch on time and function as intended.

Our creative team is looking for a Squarespace designer/developer to join us in a temporary basis. This is a fully remote position and we need at least 4 websites done in the next 60 days. Your pay will be based on experience, previous work portfolio, and project scope. The right candidate will be well-versed in design standards for websites and be able to show us examples of previous sites built using Squarespace. You will work with our creative team to ensure that projects are designed according to the project specs and timeline. Transparency and communication are required through projects to ensure we give each partner a site they are happy with. 

Responsibilities

• Develop and design new websites by taking a project brief and making a partner's website come to life

• Strong time-management skills, including the ability to meet all project deadlines on time

• Continued knowledge and growth of the Squarespace platform as it changes and improves

• Extend the platform beyond its limits, as needed, using your own code (Custom CSS) and more!

• Incorporate principles of visual design and usability to make the site delightful to use

Qualifications

• 1+ years minimum Squarespace experience

• A portfolio that shows strong design creativity using no-code and strategic thinking for a final product that is easy to manage for the end-user

• A portfolio that shows the use of code while maintaining a quick and functioning site

• Graphic Design – attention to small details and ability to create graphic elements to support site design

• Coding knowledge of Squarespace Custom CSS or Code

• Understanding of a variety of styles and design needs across many different business types

In The City-State of DBC, the health and safety of our team, citizens and communities is a top priority. This priority has become increasingly important as we continue to face the challenges of the COVID-19 pandemic. DBC believes vaccination is the best way to reduce the spread of COVID-19 and protect our team, our communities, our families and ourselves. To minimize the risk of transmission of the COVID-19 virus and maintain a safe and healthy workplace, vaccination is required for this role. (At DBC, fully vaccinated means it has been at least two weeks since you have received the second dose of a two-dose vaccine such as Moderna or Pfizer, or the single dose of a single dose vaccine, such as Johnson & Johnson).

 

Here's how our values are used to define each of us.

Autonomous - make our own rules

Brave - we critique our work to learn

Curious - we solve the right problems

Confident - we use facts over fiction

Persistent - we finish what we start

 

Let's Go To Work

title: Technology & Training Specialist
description:
Company Description

If you are a dedicated professional who loves what you do, likes having fun at work, and proactively solves challenges, we’d like to hear from you!

Lingraphica is a mission-driven organization who provides speech-generating devices to help improve communication, speech, and quality of life for people with aphasia.  We look for candidates who enjoy working in a fast-paced, goal-oriented environment, and who share our commitment to helping individuals on their aphasia journey.

 

Job Description

Purpose: 

The Technology and Training Specialist is responsible for ensuring that every customer who tries one of our devices has the best possible experience. This position will be one of the primary contacts for all customers in the Consumer Business pipeline, including a virtual orientation, initial device set-up, weekly device training sessions, and preparing customers for independent use with their device.  This role will be the liaison between the vetting, funding, and clinical teams that will support and be part of the customer journey to obtain a device. 

Essential Duties & Responsibilities: 

  • Establish rapport with our Consumer Business customers (patients & care-partners) and ensure the best possible experience 

  • Be the first point of contact for all Consumer Business customer and liaison, as appropriate, with other teams to ensure a seamless experience 

  • Conduct the initial virtual device orientation with all customers (via Zoom) 

  • Evaluate basic competencies (follow instructions, physical responses, patient needs)

  • Carry out the device trial plan established by our Clinical Technology Consultants (i.e., weekly training sessions with customers)

  • Provide basic technical support, as needed

  • Work closely with the CTCs and clients to customize devices based on the client’s functional communication needs

  • Obtain clinical information, as needed, and with the help of our internal Client Navigator team

  • Document all customer interactions in our customer relationship management (CRM) system

  • Provide continuous feedback to all Consumer Business Team members to ensure smooth transitions across the customer life-cycle

  • Ensure customers are trained and ready for independent device usage

Other Duties & Responsibilities:  

  • Maintain company standards for CRM procedure

  • Assist other members of the Consumer Business Team, as needed

  • Collect and report on key metrics within the Consumer Business Team

  • Work with others within the Consumer Business team for additional opportunities for customer engagement

  • Other duties as assigned

 

Qualifications

Education & Experience:

  • Bachelors/Associates Degree, or some college coursework preferred  

  • 1-3 years of customer service or related experience directly working with customers on the phone   

  • Experience with Lingraphica technologies, including communication devices, SmallTalk apps, TalkPath Therapy, and TalkPath News, strongly preferred 

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

  • Understand what it means to deliver a superior customer experience  

  • Strong phone skills  

  • Always maintain a calm and professional demeanor when dealing with customers  

  • The ability to identify the needs of customers and offer meaningful and timely information in response  

  • Proactively report trends and customer feedback, and recommend/implement creative solutions

  • Strong communication skills with both external customers and internal departments

  • Workload flexibility, open to change, and the ability to prioritize tasks

  • Ability to work together with persons with disabilities

  • Proficiency with HubSpot, Microsoft Excel/Word, Zoom preferred



Additional Information

Work Environment & Physical Demands 

Incumbent works from home and is expected to maintain a safe, productive work environment with secure internet access. 

Travel 

Travel to our Princeton, NJ office may be required on occasion, up to 4x / year. Occasional travel to national conventions and conferences, within the continental United States (conditional on Covid restrictions) 

Accommodations  

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty and physical demand satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities and physical demands required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  

 

To learn more about Lingraphica, visit: www.lingraphica.com!

title: Frontend Software Engineer
description:
Polecat analyses the media impact of big organisations to show them how different topics affect their reputation. This is a fast-growing market as more and more organisations start to take Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) concerns seriously.

We want to grow the frontend team working on our SaaS products. We ingest tens of millions of documents (articles or social posts) per day into our stream processing pipeline, using our scoring algorithms and models to transform natural language into measurable company and topic mentions such that our web-applications can provide engaging and interactive data visualisations and reporting / sharing tools. We aspire to make reputation, ESG and risk perception data a part of strategic decision making in all organisations.

Our frontend code is primarily TypeScript, with React being used as our rendering library. However, we are also open to candidates without Typescript experience if you have an interest in learning it and have had JavaScript experience and similarly with React, experience with similar rendering libraries would be considered relevant.

Our frontend tech stack also includes:

  • Apollo Client (GraphQL)
  • Next JS
  • Auth0

And exposure to any of these would be beneficial but not essential to get started in the role.

We have a culture of listening to engineers and taking time to produce great quality code. We don't want to be just a feature factory that racks up the technical debt; we believe that quality engineering is the foundation of a successful product. We also believe strongly in Building the Right Thing, and our engineers actively participate in the decision-making & design process.

Polecat is a fully remote company and accepting applications from anywhere within the UK and Poland. We do regular lunches and other social events in the Bristol area.

Requirements

Specific skills and experience required:

  • Minimum of 1 year of experience of building software, in a team, that is being used by real customers.
  • Degree-level capability in a maths/science/computing subject or equivalent experience.
  • Experience with React or similar rendering library languages
  • Knowledge of JavaScript or TypeScript
  • Interest in software best practices and enthusiasm for them.
  • Fluent written and spoken English.

Our ideal candidate would be someone with a history of close collaboration with product designers, DevOps specialists, backend & full stack engineers, and QA, with the ability to do cross-team tasks as required. For example, someone who is capable of contributing to high level design ideas or can apply design principles when a low-level design isn’t available or could perhaps pick up a small backend change to unblock themselves.

 

In a typical week, you might:

  • Pick up a feature story and implement it in the UI.
  • Jump on a call with the rest of the team to scope out new ideas.
  • Investigate a new technology or approach we could adopt.
  • Deploy your changes into cloud dev and stage environments, and work with QA to test them.
  • Identify a pain point and propose or implement improvements.
  • Review merge requests from other team members.

 

You’re going to love this job if you:

  • Have a do-it-yourself mentality
  • Love consistency in approach and design
  • Thrive on problem solving in a fast-paced commercial environment.
  • Like the flexibility and freedom of a start-up business culture.
  • Enjoy learning new technologies and expanding your comfort zone.

Benefits

  • Fully remote working from within the UK or Poland. Occasional meetups in Bristol, UK.
  • Flexible working arrangements possible
  • Annual holidays (25 days – increases with tenure).
  • Bank holidays (in addition to annual holiday noted above).
  • Enhanced sick time.
  • Pension plan scheme with employer match.
  • Great team environment – we’re here to help provide everything you need to be successful!

About Polecat

We’re a team of over 30 friendly & diverse people who work and play hard. We’re growing rapidly, and this role is going to grow too. You’ll report direct to the Chief Technical Officer and work closely with a world-class technical team.

You’ll have the unique opportunity to play a critical role in a business mission-critical success story, and build on your skills and talents as we grow. For the right candidate, we offer competitive remuneration, flexible working arrangements and fully remote working.

 

NO AGENCIES PLEASE.

title: Sr. Product Manager
description:
Salary Range
$110,000 USD - $130,000 USD

A bit about us

Roll20 is a free, community-based tabletop gaming software dedicated to bringing players together regardless of distance, experience, gaming system or hardware. We strive to lessen the technical burden on the participants, facilitate the formation of new gaming groups, and to make barriers to entry as few as possible when gathering around a table for camaraderie. To accomplish these goals we seek to create a service that is sustainable and will be a resource to the gaming community as long as it is needed.


The Challenge

Our 9 million players and the growing popularity of tabletop games have made Roll20 such an amazing success. Roll20 has developed a portfolio of products that have accelerated a niche hobby into the mainstream. Moving forward, there are so many directions we can take. We believe that in order to continue enhancing our platform and delivering value to our community, we need leaders who are ready to drive key decisions and product strategy.


The Opportunity

Roll20 is looking for a product manager with experience driving high-impact initiatives through cross-functional collaboration. Someone who is able to seamlessly flow between high-level strategic planning and day-to-day project execution. Through strong qualitative and quantitative data points, this Sr. Product Manager will build and execute an outcome-driven roadmap that will deliver value to more than 9 million players.


The Skill Set

  • Extensive experience as a Product Manager in a SaaS company with a track record of delivering software with high business impact.
  • Experience in the full product lifecycle from concept to scale for large initiatives.
  • Experience with, and ability to educate team members on, agile development. Understanding of how to track team health metrics such as velocity, burndown, release quality - and understand why those metrics are important.
  • Experience building, prioritizing, presenting, and maintaining product roadmaps.
  • Understanding of data analytics and how to establish and track qualitative and quantitative data points to guide key decisions and product strategy.
  • Ability to develop others to expand their knowledge and skills around product management and iterative development.


Within 1 month you'll:

  • Complete orientation, begin to learn the product, and learn Roll20’s values.
  • Become familiar with the charters of each cross functional team and their current roadmaps
  • Become familiar with our tech stack and the tools available to you as a product manager.
  • Meet and establish relationships with critical team members and key stakeholders across the organization


Within 3 months you'll:

  • Transition into product owner role of two cross functional product teams.
  • Work with ops and business intelligence teams to understand data tech stack, current SOOs and KPIs, and how the current initiatives impact those measurements.
  • Gain broader understanding of the industry and influences that impact our product.
  • Build relationships with Development, Marketing, and UX Design to support collaborations over Product tactics and strategies.
  • Drives the Product Requirements Documentation process across the Product function and Prioritized Roadmap in multiple formats.
  • Launch a product feature from start to end as the primary owner.


Within 6 months you'll:

  • Collaborate with engineering to track velocity and accuracy of engineering estimates and put in place a feedback process for learning and improving team execution.
  • Own executive reporting for all of your cross functional teams; report on the outcomes of launches and discuss how well goals and hypotheses were met, and what learnings to use in the next launch
  • Coach, develop, and mentor product managers and associate product managers as their direct supervisor.
  • Leverage data to track velocity and accuracy and improve future execution.
  • Have stronger familiarity with our product and TTRPGs and be able to intuitively understand the strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and challenges to Roll20 as a platform.

    #LI-REMOTE

Benefits

Roll20 staff, via coordination with Ritsuko Lifts LLC, are guided by company values that encourage diversity and inclusiveness. In line with company values, we provide competitive salaries and solid benefit packages, including health insurance, group life and personal accident insurance, short-term disability/long-term disability coverage, optional worksite insurance coverage, an employee assistance program, and a 401k with employer matching. We ensure staff have at least 3 weeks of vacation time away, in addition to sick leave, and flexible scheduling. We are a truly remote workplace (although we hope to get everyone together for a full company retreat once seeing people IRL is a safe thing again) and include equipment allowances for our staff to cultivate a functional working-from-home experience. We encourage applicants with non-traditional backgrounds to apply.

title: Event Marketing Manager
description:
About Current Health

Current Health is a leader in the movement to transition more healthcare into the home. We’re a technology company, but beyond our best in class hardware and software capabilities, we help healthcare organizations operationalize care at home and deliver excellent patient experiences through helping with the last mile of care logistics and services. We partner with leading healthcare organizations to advance home-based care in the US, the UK, and around the world.

More than doubling in size in the last year, we’re building a global team united in one purpose: helping people live healthier, longer lives by predicting disease and enabling earlier treatment. At Current Health, we seek to put patients first, solve problems with curiosity and creativity, pursue uncommon collaboration, and never stop growing. We’re a remote-first company, which means that everything from how we work, communicate, and socialize is shaped by tools and culture that prioritize collaboration and support independence.

Position Summary

We are looking for a passionate events manager to help us shape and execute on our events strategy. Reporting to the VP of Marketing, in this role you will never hear the phrase, “but we’ve always done it this way.” This role has the opportunity to build something from the ground up and we are looking for a creative, out-of-the-box thinker with a strong project management backbone who can redefine our approach to events to support our thought leadership, brand awareness, and revenue goals. With the way events are rapidly changing, we are looking to balance the in-person experiences that we’ve all missed with the digital opportunities that have evolved in the last year and a half. This high-visibility and cross-functional role will be responsible for bringing teams across the company together in creative ways through a diverse set of events catering to our health system and pharma customers across the US and UK.

Responsibilities

  • Oversee trade show strategy and execution, in-person and virtual speaking opportunities, and industry memberships.
  • Own our annual event calendar, keeping a pulse on our quickly evolving industry and working closely with sales to determine what events will help us achieve our revenue goals.
  • Own end-to-end execution of in-person events including large national and international trade shows as well as Current Health’s own annual customer event.
  • Identify and manage the operational logistics of speaking opportunities for both in-person events and virtual events / panels, working closely with other members of the marketing, our customer team, and the customers themselves to develop applications and content.
  • Manage vendors and internal design team to build out trade show booths, collateral, and other branding assets needed for event sponsorship.
  • Work with marketing, PR, and sales teams to coordinate pre and post-event outreach.
  • Work with people operations to support internal event planning and execution.
  • Manage the events and sponsorships budget.
  • Develop quantitative and qualitative tools to assess impact of events on business goals.


Requirements


  • Experience managing in-person B2B trade show presence (healthcare experience are ideal but not required)
  • Experience managing company-run events (internal or external)
  • Excellent attention to detail and project management
  • Experience doing long-term planning and budgeting
  • Ability to manage unexpected challenges as they arise
  • Good communication and writing skills
  • Ability to manage multiple projects at once with various priorities and stakeholders

Benefits
