title: Consumer Engagement Marketing Manager
description:
Company Description

Together we make. Come make with us.

Overview

At Cricut®, we believe that we’re all born makers. When we built our first cutting machine, we saw the potential for a simple yet powerful tool to completely transform the way people craft, design, and DIY. Since then, we continue to innovate with new machines, platforms, materials, and tools, but that’s just what we do. Who we are is a bustling worldwide community, a means for connection, and an outlet for unbridled creativity. Join us as we place the power of handmade into the hands of ALL.

Life

Love your work. And your coworkers.

Our company is made up of A+ human beings. We ask tough questions, entertain ideas outside of our own, and work together to make something bigger than ourselves. With Cricut® growing in China, the U.K., Australia, New Zealand, as well as Europe and South America, we’re on an unstoppable roll, satisfying that innate creative itch around the world. We train, develop, and celebrate great work with hallway high fives and promotions within. We also throw the world’s best Halloween party.

Enjoy incredible perks.

We take care of our team. We offer medical, dental, vision, and retirement benefits, as well as pet insurance, 401K match, life insurance, incentive programs, paid time off, on-site massages, phenomenal work-life balance, and employee discounts.

Like what you see? We can’t wait to meet you!



Job Description

The Consumer Engagement Marketing Manager will be responsible for setting the strategy and developing the plan to engage and inspire new and long-term Cricut members alike. Duties will include campaign development, project management and cross-functional partnership. The ideal candidate will work closely with social media, education, digital marketing and software/UX teams to ensure the success of all campaigns and new feature introductions.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and drive execution of marketing strategies for ongoing consumer engagement
  • Define marketing plans and programs necessary to hit annual engagement targets
  • Develop an in-depth understanding of the target audience, ensuring the plans are relevant and impactful
  • Partner with software product management team to integrate engagement programs into Cricut’s Design Space experience
  • Develop marketing plans, messaging and creative assets to support software releases, educational content and other member engagement initiatives
  • Own content calendar & execution of new Design Space home page
  • Lead marketing for Cricut Community sharing in Design Space, driving member participation
  • Lead and grow member engagement marketing team
  • Stay on top of the latest engagement trends, technologies, and competitor activity

 



Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s Degree in business, marketing or related field; an MBA is a plus
  • 7-10 years progressive marketing experience
  • Marketing – experience in developing marketing plans, defining target audience and messaging, developing marketing briefs, partnering with creative teams to execute, setting and tracking key metrics
  • Experience partnering with cross-functional teams to introduce and announce new products, features and/or programs
  • Strong project management and interpersonal skills; ability to juggle multiple projects at one time and self-prioritize workload
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Attention to detail and ability to work with focus to meet tight time schedules
  • Passion for the consumer – desire to really get to know the consumer, translating the consumer needs into messaging and experiences
  • Working at all levels – proven ability to drive strategic thinking about the marketing strategy as well as focus on the executional details


Additional Information

What to Do Next: 

Please attach your resume including links to your portfolio where applicable. If you want to show your super powers in other ways – include that information too. You can be sure that Cricut® is an employer who values individuality, equality and diversity, so tell us what you’re all about. If you are a Maker or a DIY enthusiast, whether you think you are a good one or not, we would love to hear about it when you send us your information!

At Cricut®, we celebrate inclusion and diversity. Cricut is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions based on merit. Cricut prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual identity, gender identity, marital status, veteran status, nationality, citizenship, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or any other unlawful consideration. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Cricut participates in E-Verify.

title: Revenue Accountant
description:
Hi there!

 

We're looking for a Revenue Accountant to join the Accounting team at Zapier. Zapier’s on a mission to make everyone more productive at work. Zapier has helped millions of people build businesses through the power of automation. If you love digging into numbers, automating processes, and working with people all across the company to implement new processes and launch new product lines, Zapier might be the place for you!

 

 

If you’re interested in advancing your career at a fast-growing, profitable, impact-driven company, then read on…

 

Our Commitment to Applicants

Culture and Values at Zapier

Zapier Guide to Remote Work

Zapier Code of Conduct

Diversity and Inclusivity at Zapier

 

 

About You

 

  • You're a seasoned professional. You have a minimum of 3 years of revenue accounting experience in a SaaS environment, ensuring that subscription revenue and related transactions are properly recognized under ASC 606.
  • You play well with others! You enjoy collaborating with multiple people and teams to get things done!  
  • You’re resourceful. You love a challenge, and you enjoy getting creative to solve problems. You are highly adaptable and get energized by new challenges.
  • You obsess over the details. You’re analytical, methodical, and work with a high degree of accuracy. You are detailed-oriented and care about the nitty gritty.
  • You love to jump into new projects. You're eager to take on any project that comes your way no matter how big or how small.
  • You love to write. Whether it's a quick conversation in Slack or a new policy we're implementing, writing is our main form of communication.

 

Things You Might Do

Zapier is a fast-growing and remote-first company, so you'll likely get experience on many different projects across the organization. That said, here are some things you'll probably do:

  • Oversee our revenue recognition policies and procedures to ensure we are in compliance with ASC 606.
  • Track, analyze and report on metrics, like disputes, churn rates, renewal rates, and ACH returns. 
  • Frequently monitor disputes and ensure that material disputes are handled appropriately.
  • Collaborate with our internal Data team to create dashboards and reports for collections, churn and dunning items.
  • Reconcile Netsuite to Processor reports to ensure we have recognized all the revenue items we were supposed to.
  • Work closely with our Support and Billing teams to launch new products, expand billing in other currencies or payment sources, and implement process improvements.
  • Support the organization on questions related to revenue fluctuations.
  • Create, maintain, and distribute reporting on various revenue segments.
  • Manage currency rate settings in the billing system.
  • Create or update policies and procedures as needed.
  • Review and approve or deny exceptions to billing and refund policies.  
  • Make file/no file decisions on escalated disputes.
  • Work with internal departments and payment processors to find ways to improve our processes through automation and innovative new practices.
  • Oversee manual billings from payment source exceptions and ensure that renewals are processed timely.
  • As part of our All Hands Support initiative, help customers have the best experience with Zapier as possible.

 

The Whole Package

Location: Remote

 

Our flexible, distributed environment lets us work with the best people from around the world. Zapiens live in 40+ countries, including the United Kingdom, Thailand, India, Nigeria, Taiwan, Guatemala, New Zealand, Australia, and more!

 

Zapier offers:

  • Competitive salary
  • Healthcare + dental + vision coverage*
  • Retirement plan with 4% company match*
  • Profit-sharing program for 100% of Zapiens
  • $2,000 annual learning stipend for use on courses, conferences, and more—your choice
  • Two annual all-company retreats
  • 14 weeks paid leave for new parents of biological or adopted children
  • Customized Zapiversary rewards on your 1, 3, 5, 7 and 10 year work anniversaries
  • Leading-edge equipment. We set you up with an Apple laptop and provide an additional budget for you to choose other home office accessories and software you may need.
  • Time to renew. We encourage Zapiens to take at least 2 weeks off each year. Most of us take 4-5 weeks, in addition to locally recognized holidays.
  • Opportunity to work with Zapier’s amazing partners network

*While we take care of Zapiens around the world the best we can, healthcare and retirement plans are currently available specifically in the UK, Canada, and United States.

 

 

How to Apply

 

We have a non-standard application process designed to promote inclusion and equity. We first ask a few questions in our application form that would typically be asked at the start of an initial interview. This helps speed up the process and lets us get to know you a bit better right out of the gate. Please be sure to answer each question; the resume and CV fields are optional.

 

After you apply, you are going to hear back from us—even if we don’t see an immediate fit with our team. In fact, throughout the process, we strive to make sure you never go more than seven days without hearing from us.

 

Zapier is an equal opportunity employer. We're excited to work with talented and empathetic people, and do not discriminate based on race, color, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, genetic information, pregnancy, age, or any other status protected by local law. Our code of conduct provides a beacon for the kind of company we strive to be, and we celebrate our differences because those differences are what allow us to make a product that serves a global user base.

 

 

Zapier is committed to inclusion. As part of this commitment, Zapier will ensure that people with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodations are needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact jobs@zapier.com.

title: Accounting Specialist
description:
Eliminate Crime. Build Community. 

Flock Safety provides the first public safety operating system that empowers private communities and law enforcement to work together to eliminate crime. We are committed to protecting human privacy and mitigating bias in policing with the development of best-in-class technology rooted in ethical design, which unites civilians and public servants in pursuit of a safer, more equitable society. 

Our Safety-as-a-Service approach includes affordable devices powered by LTE and solar that can be installed anywhere.  Our technology detects and captures objective details, decodes evidence in real-time and delivers investigative leads into the hands of those who matter. 

While safety is a serious business, we are a supportive team that is optimizing the remote experience to create strong and fun relationships even when we are physically apart. Our flock of hard-working employees thrive in a positive and inclusive environment, where a bias towards action is rewarded. Flock Safety is headquartered in Atlanta and operates nationwide. We have raised over $250M in venture capital including a recent Series D round led by Andreessen Horowitz.  Now surpassing a 1B valuation, Flock is scaling quickly and seeking the best and brightest to help us meet our goal of reducing crime in the United States by 25% in the next three years.

About the opportunity 

Flock Safety is looking for an Accounts Receivable/Billing Specialist to join our accounting team. The ideal candidate excels at administrative and bookkeeping support and streamlines financial record keeping. This role will be in charge of managing communications relating to invoices, as well as assisting with company bookkeeping policies, auditing business ledgers, organizing invoices and launching the collections process for client accounts with past-due balances. The Accounts Receivable/Billing Specialist will also process and record any unique billing situations that fall outside of regular operations such as custom payment plans.

This role requires the candidate to be extremely organized and have a keen eye for detail to spot any issues that may arise. It is a key role at Flock, creating a framework for securing on-time payments and optimizing cash flow management.

How You Will Take Flight With Flock

  • Maintain the billing system
  • Generate invoices and account statements
  • Perform account reconciliations
  • Maintain accounts receivable files and records
  • Produce monthly financial and management reports
  • Investigate and resolve any irregularities or inquiries
  • Assist in general financial management and analysis

About You

  • Strong ability to prioritize and manage expectations
  • Possesses a keen eye for detail
  • Enjoys and thrives while working independently (we are a remote-first culture)
  • Communicates articulately and efficiently with other people within the company and customers
  • Has a focused mathematical background
  • Preference for experience with Sage Interact and Salesforce

Why join the Flock? 

When you join the Flock, you are joining a diverse team of passionate, ambitious, intelligent people that put team over self. We offer competitive salary (commensurate with experience), equity in the company, take what you need vacation policy, and the opportunity to grow your career at a fast-paced, high growth mission-driven startup. We genuinely care about the well-being of our employees both in and out of the office and understand the importance of work/life balance. We’d love for you to join us in the fight to eliminate crime, one community at a time.

We're building the virtual world for language learning. We all know that textbooks, zoom, and vocabulary apps can only take you so far. Sooner or later it's time to dive in. That's where we come in. We put you in real life situations, with real people so you can finally speak confidently.

We're looking for a Senior Product Manager to join our team to help discover and deliver some of the foundational features to support users learning with Immerse.

In this role you will:
  • Drive product features through their entire creative cycle: ideation, specification, development, release, analysis, and iteration
  • Perform qualitative and quantitative research to discover feature ideas and validate them before development
  • Work closely with UI/UX and learning designers to ensure an excellent, efficacious user experience
  • Work with engineers and VR developers to help guide feature development
  • Perform quantitative analysis on features' performance and find opportunities for optimization
  • Be responsible for hitting the key performance indicators you are entrusted with
We are looking for some with:
  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Business, Psychology, Design or an equivalent field
  • 3+ years of professional experience as a PM or in highly related areas, such as software engineering, design, data analysis, language learning, or brand management. 
  • A desire to make the world a better place through technology and education
  • Ability to utilize knowledge of user insights, data, and statistical analyses to inform decisions
  • An instinct for creating simple and intuitive user experiences
  • A proven ability to learn fast
  • Experience leading projects and teams
  • Expert knowledge of and ability to communicate and document software architecture and design principles
  • At least 1 year successful experience in a startup or smaller, entrepreneurial, fast-growth organization
  • Comfortable working in fast-moving, ambiguous development environments
  • A constant desire to learn, improve, and help others improve
Bonus points if you also have:
  • Advanced degree in Computer Science, Design, Psychology, or an equivalent field
  • Professional experience in the education sector
Remote Work Details:
  • Must be available for collaboration between 9PM-3PM PST
  • Must have access to a distraction free, quiet space during work hours
  • Must be available to attend one all team annual retreat (pending pandemic guidelines)
What Happens Next:

We aim to make you experience throughout the hiring process straightforward, speedy, and transparent. We want to make sure that we are right for you as much as the other way around. The hiring process for this role follows the steps below:

  1. Resume and application review - We will review it as quickly as possible
  2. Let's chat - Quick chat with our recruiter about your experience and the role 
  3. A video call - 40-minute call with the hiring manager 
  4. A behavioral interview - 1-2 hour interview to give us the chance to learn how you think about Product, ask deeper questions about your experience, and for you to ask any outstanding questions .

title: Founding Head of Growth
description:
About Fella

Fella is the telehealth clinic for men with obesity. Obesity is the largest chronic disease dramatically affecting people's lives and causing billions of dollars of healthcare spending. But the standard treatment of diet and exercise doesn't work for most with chronic obesity. With Fella, patients meet a board-certified obesity doctor to prescribe FDA-approved medications and join a lifestyle intervention program through our app. We are now live in Texas, our first group of patients are having life-changing results, and we are soon to expand nationwide. We're now hiring our core team.

 

We are backed by top health/consumer investors and angels:

  • Y Combinator, BrandProject, Global Founders Capital
  • The founders of Indeed, Curative, Alan, Kaia Health, Not Boring, Vouch Insurance

 

The opportunity

Fella is building a world-class team. As Head of Growth, you'll design, build and scale out Fella's growth engine. You'll manage a large growth marketing budget. You'll become an expert in telling and distributing the Fella story to potential fellas — performance marketing will be core, but you'll work hard to use other channels.

We'll empower you to direct your growth organization and be an important leader in the company. Success in this role is a direct track to becoming our CMO.

This role is FTE and you can work from anywhere in US or European timezones.

You'll report directly to Fella's co-founder Richie Cartwright.

 

Example responsibilities
  • Process — a clear process for prioritizing your efforts and running experiments.
  • Performance marketing — guiding the set up and running of ads, as well as constantly improving the ads (creative, copy, targeting).
  • Analytics — guiding implementation of a complete analytics stack.
  • Conversion optimization — identify bottlenecks, design experiments, and work closely with our growth engineer to regularly ship funnel changes.
  • Experiments in other channels — choose which channels to experiment with, and running whole experiments end-to-end.
  • Qualitative customer learning — you'll be as obsessed with the fellas as the rest of the Fella team. Therefore you'll want to learn why they're converting, and why they are not. You'll want exposure to customer calls, Facebook ad comments, product feedback.

 

About you
  • Experience:
    • 6+ years in growth marketing, 2+ years leading growth initiatives in a consumer company
    • You're able to:
      • set the strategic direction
      • manage a tight process & high-performing team
      • guide implementation of the infrastructure & analytics stack
      • design experiments with a strong data focus
      • get your hands dirty in the implementation
    • You'll be able to guide the set up and running of ads, as well as constantly improve the ads: creative, copy, targeting.
  • Three core qualities as a growth marketer (h/t to Julian Shapiro):
  1. Proactiveness when crafting experiments and scaling them.
  2. Process for consistently generating growth ideas & prioritizing the important ones.
  3. Reflectiveness and data literacy when assessing what growth successes and failures have taught you.
  • Based in US or European timezones
  • Bonus:
  • Experience in engineering / software / tech
  • Experience in consumer healthcare

Benefits
  • Competitive salary, equity, and unlimited PTO
  • 401(k) contributions
  • Private medical insurance
  • Paid parental leave
  • Personal development budget (including books, courses, coaching and more)
  • Personal wellness budget (including gym membership, meditation apps and more)
  • Regular team off-sites

 

How to apply

Email richie@joinfella.com with:

  • your CV
    • if you'd like, in addition to your CV, please include extra details of your most impressive role(s) in growth marketing
  • your phone number

title: Product Designer
description:
The Room is a marketplace connecting brands with people who love them. Our customers exchange products and experiences for media generated by influential people all through our platform.
The role

  • This is a contract role outside IR35 for six months with a day rate of £500.
  • Our team is fully remote and so you can work exclusively from home, although we need you to be based in the UK. We will eventually open an office base in London for meet-ups and team events.
  • Our product and technology team is nine people in total, although we are currently hiring for three additional roles.
  • The Room also includes sales, marketing, customer success and finance teams. The whole company is about 30 people.
  • You would report to our CTO (me) or another engineering manager when we hire them. I report to our two founders, Alex and Tanya.
  • I started my career as a software engineer and have been a CTO for 13+ years, growing teams from 0-50 in startups and small and large businesses. My last job was CTO of Gumtree. This is not my first rodeo!
  • You’re welcome no matter what your age, gender, sexuality, race or physical ability. We believe your experience is valuable and should have a voice.

What you’ll do

We’ve raised funding to build the next generation of our technology, opening up The Room to a global audience and we need you to help us get there.

We are scaling and hiring inspiring, thoughtful and motivated people to push us forward. We’re looking for a talented Product Designer to join our growing team and help design our new platform.

  • Design the UX/UI for interactions in The Room’s websites and apps.
  • Maintain a steady pipeline of designed features.
  • Work with engineers to build fast, effective web and mobile interfaces.
  • Research customer needs and provide feedback on discoveries.
  • Facilitate workshop sessions and design sprints.
  • Work through wireframes, visual designs and prototypes.
  • It’s essential that you have at least three years of recent work experience building websites and/or published apps as part of cross-functional teams.
  • Background designing user-focused experiences for web and mobile.
  • An intuitive nature to unearth customer needs and design what matters.
  • Flexible, collaborative approach while working in teams.
  • Very high standards for product polish.
  • Ability to clearly present and articulate ideas with patience and empathy.
  • Experience using Figma to collaborate in teams.
  • A portfolio of work to share.

Bonus points

  • Front-end skills using HTML and CSS.
  • Experience with designing user interfaces for React.
  • Knowledge of Tailwind CSS.

How we work

  • We work in Agile cross-functional teams using Scrum, with stand-ups, sprint planning and retrospectives.
  • Work is organised using Jira and documented with Confluence.
  • We’ll get you a MacBook Pro or high spec PC laptop if you prefer.
  • You’ll communicate using Google Workspace (G Suite) and Slack.

Hiring process

  • The first stage is a half-hour call with our CTO (me). I’ll ask about your experience, skills and approach.
  • Next, there is a one-hour video call with another product designer and our CTO. We’ll talk through your portfolio and dig deeper on projects you’ve worked on.
  • The final stage is a conversation with two of our team. They will answer any questions you may have about the platform, team or company.
  • That’s it. We don’t believe in take-home exercises. We try to keep the process as painless as possible.

Next step

If you’d like to apply, please click the Apply button, fill out your details and we’ll be in touch. We don’t want help from agencies or any other recruiters, thanks.

title: Bilingual Customer Success Representative (English/Spanish)
description:
You’re reading this job description which means 2 things. 1) You’re job searching in a global pandemic and 2) We’re hiring in a global pandemic. But -- before we get down to business, humanity comes first. From us to you, hang in there; you've got this. Nevertheless, you are here to learn about us, so off we go.

We are Booksy. Hi! We describe ourselves as an appointment booking software for the beauty industry. Even though our "friend" COVID changed the landscape quite a bit, we still hold true to our values from day 1. We have been able to push onward and upward during the most trying time and through it all continue to support and find passion in helping beauty professionals amplify their artistry. It’s our job to provide them with tools to make running their business smoother and their lives simpler. Taking a 30,000 foot view of the world today, we pride ourselves on being ambitious. To continue on our journey to reach new heights this year, we’re looking for people like you to help us ultimately become the most trusted solution for appointment-based service providers. Period. Boom. Mic Drop.

As a Customer Success Rep, you will be working with business owners within the Health and Beauty industry. You will be responsible for helping our providers set up their profile and use our tools to grow their business. You will not only be a product expert and knowledgeable on all things Booksy but accountable for preventing churn, maintaining account health and making sure our providers are using our app to its fullest capacity and aware of all the product features.

Requirements

  • Effectively multi-task and manage a large volume of calls, emails, and chats
  • Supply accurate and complete information to providers by staying informed on the most up to date product features
  • Keep records of provider interactions, inquiries and concerns via CRM management

  • Identify, develop and recognize opportunities to improve processes to efficiently manage workflow
  • Analyze churn trends and provider usage data
  • Work closely with Global CS team in Poland, UK, Brazil and Spain to solve problems

Who you are:

  • Have at least 1+ year(s) of sales and/or account management experience with technology/SaaS companies
  • Ability to combine technical “know how” with empathy, patience and strong communication skills
  • Experience supporting customers using SaaS solutions or internet/mobile products
  • Success working in a fast-paced, dynamic and forward thinking environment
  • Coachable and eager to learn; maintains a positive attitude and thinks “big picture”
  • Comfortable making outbound calls and providing innovative solutions to meet provider needs
  • Strong organizational skills with attention to detail
  • You’re a self-starter, We’re a start-up. Innovation is a requirement and ideas are expected
  • Familiarity with CRM systems and ability to learn new software
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Must be customer-obsessed and able to adapt and respond to a diverse provider network
  • Adaptability - you embrace new challenges and aren’t afraid of tough conversations
  • Ability to multitask, prioritize and manage time effectively

Benefits

  • Health/Dental/Vision/Commuter Benefits/401k

title: Backend/Middleware QA Automation Engineers
description:
Backend/Middleware QA Automation Engineers

Mid to Senior Level 5 – 10 years

100% remote work

Leading Path Consulting is looking for dedicated and passionate QA Automation Engineers to join our cloud networking team. If you have experience building and operating scalable, cloud based, web applications, are excited about impacting millions of users, look no further!

We practice Agile/Scrum methodology and we program in a variety of languages such as Python. We are building a large-scale and high-performance cloud-based networking service platform that will deliver the next generation of Internet services across private and public networks.

title: Accounting Manager
description:

title: SEO Manager

title: Client Success Manager
description:
Equip is a virtual program helping families recover from eating disorders at home with comprehensive, gold-standard care created by experts in the field and people in recovery. Equip's five-person care teams include dietitians, physicians, therapists, and mentors who deliver wrap-around support to provide families healing and lasting recovery.

We created Equip to increase access to evidence-based treatment for all people affected by eating disorders. In line with this mission, we are committed to partnering closely with insurance companies and ensuring our team, patients, treatment, and brand reflect the diversity of those affected by eating disorders.

About the role:

We are seeking a dynamic Client Success Manager with strong communication and relationship skills and a can-do attitude to join our growing team to revolutionize health care delivery. This position will be focused on supporting our health plan, provider, and partner clients from implementation through ongoing value delivery.

The ideal candidate will be able to both dig into the operational details of program delivery as well as build strong relationships and lead outcome conversations with client executives. The Client Success Manager will serve as the subject matter expert for their client bases' program delivery strategy, operational customizations, outcome metrics, program KPIs, analytical needs, program trends, and client specific program goals.

What you'll do:

  • Support 5-10 clients from implementation through ongoing value delivery
  • Serve as intermediary to fairly represent client interests and needs the Equip business (product feedback, operational design/support, member support, clinical care)
  • Quarterback day-to-day program delivery, working closely with clinical operations and admissions leadership to deliver on program KPIs
  • Execute on payor penetration strategy to identify and maintain referral partners within each client
  • Accountable for client satisfaction, client renewals & expansion opportunities to new markets, states, and lines of business, contract adherence, contract P&L, contract utilization
  • Identify areas of opportunity to grow, scale, and optimize Equip program delivery
  • Produce and deliver high quality, actionable client meeting agendas, report content, etc.
  • Assist in creation of Client Services strategy framework and content library to lay the groundwork for standard, scalable Client Relationships that promote excellence and the Equip values
  • Ensure our clients are well positioned for program success by executing a best in class implementation and account management strategy that achieves key program milestones and exceeds expectations

Requirements

  • 2+ years of experience in client success, implementation or project management
  • Strong understanding of health care landscape, specifically payer and provider focused
  • Proven experience leading multidisciplinary teams to deliver against aggressive project timelines using project management tools and processes
  • Adept at building strong working relationships, understanding roles and responsibilities within complex organizations, and representing the needs of both the Equip team and client
  • Experience owning and managing multiple concurrent relationships with a diverse client base
  • Key analytical abilities to generate program KPIs and insights both for internal and external stakeholders with an eye towards operational excellence and superior value delivery
  • Excitement at the prospect to build the playbooks and then execute on them

Bonus if you have the following:

  • A passion for living our mission and values
  • Sales experience
  • Experience with data & analytics (building dashboards)

Benefits

Competitive salaries and bonuses, flexible hours from home, flexible time-off, health benefits, career development opportunities, and exciting team retreats are among the myriad benefits you'll experience while working at Equip.

Equip is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Senior React frontend developer (all genders)
description:
You are a frontend expert in developing innovative online solutions, starting with analyzing and defining customer requirements, through development, testing, and finally launching them? What would be a plus: 

  • Experience in agile development and project workflows  
  • Understanding of backend development 
  • Umbraco knowledge 


At Cocomore, we strive for diversity, equality and inclusiveness. Please read our statement of diversity here: https://www.cocomore.com/diversity-statement

title: Mobile Engineer (Flutter)
description:
Cloudwalk builds tech to deliver payment products to empower small and medium size businesses.
 
Our vision is to create a global payment network, starting with being already the fastest-growing acquirer in Brazil helping 150.000+ merchants with the lowest transaction fees and a default no-fee anticipation of cash flows.
 
We are experiencing an extraordinary growth in 2021.
Our business is growing and so is our fully remote and global team!
 
If you are resilient, curious, and resourceful, you will thrive with us. What matters to us is a deep insight into technology, passion for disruptive innovation; ability to learn fast and execute faster.
 
Willing to make a difference in the fastest-growing financial industry scale-up? – Come join the mission!
 
The Mobile team builds beautiful mobile applications for hundreds of thousands of customers. Deep collaboration with experts in product and design will be part of your day-to-day activities.
You will be extending and improving our Android and iOS applications using Flutter. Our application is already positioned pretty high on the mobile stores, and your work will push the application even higher in the list.
As a member of the engineering team, you are expected to have a high bar for the quality of code and the quality of user experience. Due to the nature of our business, candidates with the ability to handle multiple projects with changing priorities will thrive at CloudWalk.



What you will be doing:
  • Build, test and deploy new user-facing code in Dart for Flutter technology
  • Craft trustworthy user experiences
  • Investigate and fix problems, alongside performance and scalability issues
  • Assist in planning, estimation, and scoping of feature development

  • Relevant experience with mobile app development using Dart language and the Flutter Framework

Diversity and Inclusion
We believe in social inclusion, respect, and appreciation of all people. We promote a welcoming work environment, where each CloudWalker can be authentic, regardless of gender, ethnicity, race, religion, sexuality, mobility, disability, or education.

title: Content Writer and Editor
description:
Do you want to use your communication and writing skills to help make a positive impact on the world?

Rotunda Software is looking for a Content Editor, who is eager to take ownership of all of Rotunda Software’s communications. This is a remote role where you’ll join a talented team of passionate professionals. A successful candidate will have extensive experience framing ideas, architecting information, and inspiring customers. If you take great pleasure in deconstructing ideas, communicating simply and engaging customers, you will thrive in this position.

Our two flagship products are Ministry Scheduler Pro and Volunteer Scheduler Pro, scheduling tools actively used by over 3,500 organizations to schedule over one million volunteers. Requirements

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Previous experience working as a copywriter and / or editor.

  • Ability to work independently and deliver quality work in a time-efficient manner.
  • Strong teamwork, time management, and project management skills.

Benefits

  • Meaningful work in a service-focused environment.

title: SaaS E-Learning and Training Manager
description:

The Academy is designed to maximise product expertise, while ensuring the successful onboarding of new staff and customers.

As our eLearning & Training Manager , you will be tech savvy and passionate about continuous learning and development. You will have the ability to effectively engage learners and to create impactful, customer-centric educational content.

Note: This is a fully remote position open to candidates based in the UK/Europe

In this role you will:

  • Create training modules and learning resources to drive knowledge of Gatekeeper software features for our internal teams and customers
  • Select the most effective delivery methods for each area of learning, combining resources such as video, demos and practical exercises, including the selection of a Learning Management System (LMS)

title: Commercial Analytics Engineer
description:
Urban Grid Solar Projects is a leader in building clean energy solutions through utility-scale solar project development. Urban Grid has provided utilities and corporate clients with more 497MWac of clean energy to date and is actively developing a growing portfolio consisting of 9,300 MWac solar PV and 1,728 MWac energy storage throughout eleven states across the U.S. Our large-scale photovoltaic power plants are a vital source of clean, renewable energy that will help shape the diversified electric grid of the future.

At Urban Grid, we are focused on taking utility-scale solar power and energy storage facilities through the full development process, from land acquisition through initial commercial operation. We are actively developing a growing portfolio of projects that will require strong stakeholder relationships to be successful.

Job Summary

The Commercial Analytics Engineer will contribute to the company’s expanding standalone energy storage and renewable project portfolio as a subject matter expert on nodal market and congestion analysis. The Commercial Analytics Engineer will be responsible for identification of risk/opportunities, perform production cost modeling, perform fundamental analysis of congestion risk in nodal power markets, and transmission capacity/upgrade costs evaluation.

Responsibilities

  • Perform near and long-term nodal production cost studies to forecast the projected price impacts and performance of a changing generation fleet.
  • Manage and maintain the latest model inputs (Generation data, fuel forecasts, monitored flowgates, etc.) in order to forecast LMPs.
  • Perform detailed analysis of congestion in nodal markets.
  • Perform and calibrate optimal power flow models to help with understanding congestion (i.e. PowerWorld).
  • Develop and streamline processes and automation to support an efficient workflow.
  • Articulate and explain nodal market model inputs/outputs to all project stakeholders with analysis, modelling and assessments of impacts.
  • Represent Urban Grid in RTO/ISO stakeholder committees and processes.

Requirements


  • Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, or Finance preferred.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills are required. The candidate must possess the ability to translate complex analysis into executive summaries.
  • Minimum of 1 year of experience in the electric utility, renewable industry, trading firm, or consulting firm.
  • Proficient with PROMOD required.
  • Proficient in running optimal power flow studies in PowerWorld required.
  • Advanced Excel skills, Python, VBA, SQL, or other programming skills highly desired.
  • Understanding or growing knowledge of power market pricing, basis risk, and congestion is required.
  • Familiarity with FERC OATT and regional interconnection processes is preferred.
  • Strong work ethic and exceptionally high work standards.
  • Must have strong organizational capacity to simultaneously manage multiple projects with competing deadlines and be able to quickly adapt to changes and shift priorities to meet project needs and deadline.
  • Ability to work independently.

Location: Remote working is acceptable for this role. Position may require periodic trips to Richmond, VA for team meetings or site visits to support engineering and development activities.

Benefits

Urban Grid offers comprehensive benefits including: Health, Dental, Vision, Flexible Spending Account, Retirement plan with matching and paid parental leave. Full-time position with compensation commensurate with experience.

title: Campaign Operations Manager
description:
We believe in the power of hiring. Because the potential for people to do something outstanding has everything to do with being in the right role, on the right team, at the right time. That’s where Greenhouse comes in – from recruiting to on-boarding, we make software to help every company be great at hiring.

Greenhouse is looking for a Campaign Operations Manager to join our team!

Reporting to our Director of Digital Marketing, you'll play a key role in implementing marketing programs and campaigns through supporting the execution of efficient, repeatable, and reportable campaigns across our digital platforms. With a keen eye for detail and meticulous organization skills, you'll become the subject matter expert on the templates and processes necessary to help our Customer Marketing team execute at scale.

Led by marketing operations and in partnership with the entire marketing organization, you'll bring your passion for driving processes to the table as a human center of excellence providing leadership, best practices, scalability, support, and training to execute Customer Marketing campaigns. 

Who will love this job
  • An organization aficionado – Naming conventions are a guilty pleasure. Plans and processes are what make you tick. You love spreadsheets and checklists and you don’t care who knows it 
  • A problem solver – you love understanding how things work so you can find solutions on your own, especially when it comes to technology
  • A lover of learning – you learn quickly because you don't wait for others to teach you; rather, you go out and find the answers with the tools and resources you have
  • A data devotee – you're mildly obsessed with the stories that can be told with data, and you love to spread the word 
  • A collaborative communicator – understanding complex topics comes easy to you, but you excel just as much in explaining them easily to others
What you’ll do
  • Build, execute, and report on marketing campaigns using our MarTech stack

  • Own customer campaign and program templates across technology stack

You should have
  • Experience with Marketo, webinar technologies, and Salesforce or other CRMs
  • Experience in a marketing, operations, or project management role
  • Experience with email marketing and producing webinars
  • Strong attention to detail and a love of organization
  • Love of data and telling stories with campaign analytics

title: Product Manager
description:
CourseStorm streamlines access to education by providing powerful class registration, enrollment management, and marketing tools that are simple for learners and educators to use. We’ve already connected over 350,000 students with education – and we’re growing fast. We’re seeking a motivated, curious, and skilled Product Manager to help us design the future of our platform and amplify the impact we can have.

You will work directly with teams across CourseStorm to develop roadmaps, design the product, oversee and guide its development, and shape the future of access to education. We're looking for someone who genuinely enjoys learning, listening, and collaborating to make fantastic customer experiences. You'll be part of an energized startup environment filled with interesting challenges and take advantage of a rare opportunity to join the leadership team at our fast-growing company.

Requirements

Responsibilities

  • Coordinate heavily with the Engineering Manager on day-to-day progress of Product project work. Creating plans, answering questions, generating designs, performing QA (at the design/behavioral level), etc.
  • Work with multiple stakeholders at the Leadership level to create a Product Roadmap
    • Stakeholders include: Business, Marketing, Sales, Finance, Software Engineering, and Customer Success
    • Gather and prioritizing product and customer requirements
    • Scope and prioritize projects based on business and customer impact
    • Package the Roadmap into a narrative to describe what is being achieved and why it's a priority
    • Working closely with Engineering to develop high level project outlines and timelines for execution before more detailed plans are made.
  • Act as the primary recipient of Product feedback from the company. Work with team members to develop systems to organize and structure that feedback into a useful format to help guide Product updates.
  • On a project level
    • Develop a Product Plan including user stories, feature and UX descriptions, as well as UI mockups that meet Core UX Values.
    • Responsible for continued coordination between stakeholders, answering questions that arise during development, etc by acting as point person for the projects.
    • Ensure products and releases are launched correctly and on schedule
  • Run beta and pilot programs with early-stage products and samples
  • Perform research, conduct customer development, synthesize, and provide recommendations based on insights
  • Create and report on Product KPIs
  • Responsible for management
    • Hire/Review/Promote/Termination of team members (Hiring & Termination processes will involve multiple stakeholders)
    • Make resource requests for equipment, new team members, etc.
    • Budgetary management, as needed


You'll Love this Job if You...

  • Are passion about designing fantastic customer experiences
  • Care deeply about creating an experience that’s simple for everyone to use
  • Love working with people across domains and designing a cohesive Product strategy
  • Want your work to make a big impact both for learners around the country and for CourseStorm
  • Hold yourself and your work to a high standard and have a fundamental need to work with others who do the same
  • Are excited about being an early part of a rapidly growing team


Skills & Requirements

  • 3+ years of product and team management experience
  • Demonstrated success defining and launching excellent products
  • Exceptional writing and editing skills combined with strong presentation and public speaking skills
  • Outstanding group leadership and facilitation skills
  • Natural ability to simplify complexity
  • Storytelling ability to paint a compelling narrative to inspire teams and customers
  • Ability to create detailed Product project plans in coordination with Engineering leadership
  • Strong, direct experience designing software UI/UX
  • Strong understanding of (does not need to have prior direct professional experience in these areas, but must have a strong adjacent experience, exposure, and understanding):
    • Software Engineering (web-based)
    • Business, Sales, and Marketing
    • Customer Success
    • Operations
  • Ability to balance the needs of sales, marketing, current customers and future opportunities.
  • A comfort with making hard decisions and prioritization tradeoffs between stakeholders knowing that every decision is imperfect, but can drive toward a better future
  • An ability to communicate a narrative that rallies stakeholders behind a vision regardless of their individual interest


Benefits

  • A healthy and thriving company culture -- you get to work with an amazing team.
  • A rare opportunity to influence the company at the leadership level
  • Health Insurance
  • Dental Insurance
  • Vision Insurance
  • SIMPLE IRA w/ matching
  • Paid time off
  • Paid holidays
  • Unique $250 / year education stipend: buy books, classes, videos, etc -- just learn something new!


Remote work is available and you may choose to work from home, however candidates must be able to travel to our office in Orono, Maine, at least 4 times per year.

At CourseStorm, empathy and inclusivity shape the heart of our company. We believe that everyone is needed to build a better world through education. The unique experiences, perspectives, and talents of our team members aren’t accessories – they are instrumental to our success and the impact we make. We welcome anyone with an open mind and an open heart to join us on this journey.

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
We're transforming the world of freight
Dray Alliance is pioneering truly digital-first port logistics and is one of the fastest-growing companies in the world of supply chain. We’ve raised tens of millions of capital from top venture capital firms like Matrix Partners and Craft Ventures. Since our founding in 2018, we’ve been on a mission to transport freight more efficiently by eliminating waste.
 
Did you know that 90% of all goods are transported by shipping containers? Every year, tens of millions of shipping containers arrive in the U.S. carrying the goods that we use every day, from iPhones to toys to medical supplies. Incumbents still rely on emails and phone calls to move these containers to and from the port. We’re using data and technology to transform this system (“drayage”), and we hold ourselves to the high standard of delivering radical -- not just incremental -- solutions to the problem.
 
Introducing our remote-first working model
As the future of work evolves, so do we. As a company, we have a remote-first working model. Individual teams and roles may be open to remote, in-office, or flex work.
 
- Remote: Do your best work from home? If your role doesn’t require you to be in the office, you can work from anywhere in the United States.
- Office: Prefer the perks of working from an office? Or in a role that requires you to be onsite with your team? Work from our amazing office in Long Beach or get a reimbursement towards an office or coworking space near where you live.
- Flex: Looking for a mix of both? Create a flex approach that works for you (and your team!) and work from the office part of the week.
 
The Role
 
We are looking for a Senior Product Designer to provide creative and technical expertise to take concepts into beautiful products. We’re looking for candidates that think beyond just interfaces and apps and want to work across multiple touch points. The ideal candidate is a passionate, energetic, and hands-on designer who has previously worked with agile teams preferably in a highly operational industry.
 
This role reports directly to the Head of Design, and embedded in our mission teams.



What this role entails
  • Leading user studies by defining key research questions and objectives, identifying appropriate methods, and synthesizing data and research into actionable insights and design recommendations
  • Design across different platforms including desktop, mobile, and email
  • Create end-to-end product design for new projects by creating wireframes and high fidelity designs in Figma
  • Work closely with Product Managers, users, and stakeholders to understand what we are solving
  • Working closely with the engineers, we go through a series of daily stand-ups and QA to make sure our solution is on track with the design and bug-free.



What success in this role looks like
  • Be the subject matter experts with whom our users are and what problems they’re encountering. understand their motivations, triggers, aspirations, and goals.
  • Ensure that designs are effectively solving problems and are delivered on time
  • Demonstrate the use of information architecture, typography, copy, and visual hierarchy to efficiently solve complex problems
  • Designs are detail oriented that addresses our target users and edge cases
  • Create beautiful and user friendly products that solves real world problems for our users



Why Work Here
  • Competitive Salary, Bonus, and Equity
  • Full Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits
  • Flexible vacations and holidays
  • Remote days
  • Be involved with shaping our organization from the ground up
Who We Are
 
Dray Alliance is a venture-backed company on a mission to transform the trucking and logistics industry, starting with drayage. Our technology simplifies the antiquated process of moving containers across short distances, with focus on port and rail moves.
 
We are on an exciting journey to modernize the logistics and trucking industry, and we are looking for humble, analytical, and passionate people to join us.
 
Our business grew at a rapid pace in 2020, and we are searching for a UX/UI designer to build and scale product offerings (for truckers, shippers, and other stakeholders).
 
What’s it like to work at Dray Alliance?
We look at Dray Alliance as a constant work in progress and we live the spirit of continuous improvement. We work in a company of humble, analytical, curious people who treat their colleagues exceptionally well. We’re a highly cross-functional organization and leverage these relationships and teamwork to win.
 
You're encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description. Your skills and passion will stand out—and set you apart—especially if your career has taken some twists and turns. We welcome diverse perspectives and people who think rigorously and aren't afraid to challenge assumptions. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Enterprise Support Account Manager
description:
About DAT

DAT is a next-generation SaaS technology company that has been at the leading edge of innovation in transportation supply chain logistics for 43 years. We continue to transform the industry year over year, by deploying a suite of software solutions to millions of customers every day - customers who depend on DAT for the most relevant data and most accurate insights to help them make smarter business decisions and run their companies more profitably. We operate the largest marketplace of its kind in North America, with 226 million freight posts in 2020, and a database of $126 billion of annual global shipment market transaction data. We have co-headquarters in Portland, OR and Denver, CO, and additional offices in MO, TX, and Bangalore, India. For additional information, see www.DAT.com/company.

The Opportunity

DAT is looking for an Enterprise Support Account Manager to join our award-winning Product Support team, located in Beaverton, Oregon.  

In this high-impact, customer facing role, you‘ll bring all your expertise in delivering outstanding product support. Through both outbound and inbound communication you’ll provide VIP service to Enterprise customers. 

This fully remote, work from home opportunity, is open to applicants who are full time residents of the following states:

AK, AL, AR, AZ, CA, CO, CT, DC, FL, GA, HI, ID, IL, IN, KS, KY, LA, MA, ME, MT, MO, NC, ND, NE, NH, NJ, NM, NY, OK, OR, PA, RI, TN, TX, UT, VT, WA, WI, WV.

Candidate Profile

  • Professionalism, drive, and initiative to quickly become a product expert.
  • Ownership approach to resolving customer questions and delivering solutions.
  • Exceptional time management, follow through, and multitasking abilities.
  • Extraordinary teamwork and communication skills.

What You’ll Do

  • Deliver excellent customer service, product support, and customer training.
  • Proactively retains customers by making outbound calls to identify revenue opportunities, update account information, educate customers and gather feedback. 
  • Identify and communicate potential sales opportunities.
  • Escalate and coordinate issues and resolution.
  • Respond to open issues and function as a technical advisor.

title: People & Capabilities Manager (HR)
description:

title: Compliance Analyst
description:
Company Description

100% REMOTE MUST BE UK BASED

When you join Turnitin, you'll be welcomed into a company that is a recognized innovator in the global education space. For more than 20 years, Turnitin has partnered with educational institutions to promote honesty, consistency, and fairness across all subject areas and assessment types. Over 16,000 academic institutions, publishers, and corporations use our services: Gradescope by Turnitin, iThenticate, Turnitin Feedback Studio, Turnitin Originality, Turnitin Similarity, ExamSoft, and ProctorExam.

Our diverse community of colleagues are all unified by a shared desire to make a difference in education. Come join us, and let's make change together.



Job Description

Turnitin is seeking a high-energy, broadly-skilled, and detail-oriented Compliance Analyst, who possesses a passion for data protection and security, and risk management. The Compliance Analyst will be responsible for working closely with all departments at Turnitin, and our family of products focusing on Technology and Information Security. This role will report to the Chief Security Officer, who will set clear goals, and assist collaboratively with strategic initiatives. This position will be supervised by the CSO’s program manager, together being the responsible authority for company-wide data, availability, and security governance.

Job functions include authoring and maintaining policies, managing audits, and working
collaboratively with key leaders and influencers across all organizations; the Compliance
Analyst will be responsible for tactical execution of the majority of GRC at the enterprise. Job functions also include creation and curation of trainings, facilitation of attestation evidence to customers, and managing projects related to information security.  Responsibilities are heavily focused on information technology security and global data privacy / protection, but candidates must only demonstrate a desire and ability to learn these concepts, while possessing reasonable experience with governance, risk, and compliance.  Responsibilities are heavily focused on information technology security and global data privacy / protection, but candidates must only demonstrate a desire and ability to learn these concepts, while possessing reasonable experience with governance, risk, and compliance.

  • Aligns with industry-standard and industry-accepted frameworks to govern data privacy, availability, confidentiality, processing-integrity, and security at the Turnitin enterprise through ownership of policies, facilitation of standards, and educating personnel to author conforming processes and guidelines.
  • Manages external audit initiatives, including multiple, independent SOC2 Type 1 and 2 programs, attestations to governing operating entities, and customer compliance attestations tactically performed by proposal professionals.
  • Empowers departments through compliance and governance programs by focusing on consistent and clear policies that provide consistent and clear guidance and guardrails to those they govern.
  • Assesses risk by identifying areas of non-compliance and evaluating risks related to key technology processes.
  • Provides central oversight to deliver consistency and quality in compliance work across the technology organization
  • Effective communicator who can convey the changing risk landscape to technical and non-technical stakeholders confidently.
  • Self-motivated, with the ability to work proactively; alone, or as part of a team, with the flexibility to change priorities in a fast-paced environment.
  • Business Continuity Program and Disaster Recovery Program management and documentation
  • IT Vendor Compliance management and documentation



Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent professional experience (CISA, CISSP, ISSMP)
  • 1-3 years of experience with Information Security, Privacy and Compliance Program Management.
  • Experience in IT Compliance, IT Audit, IT Security, or IT related field
  • Technology Policy & Compliance Management and Documentation (CIS Top 20, SOC2, GDPR, CCPA, NIST experience preferred)



Additional Information

Our Mission is to ensure the integrity of global education and meaningfully improve learning outcomes. 

Our Values underpin everything we do.

  • Customer Centric - We realize our mission to ensure integrity and improve learning outcomes by  putting educators and learners at the center of everything we do.

  • Passion for Learning - We seek out teammates that are constantly learning and growing and build a workplace which enables them to do so.

  • Integrity - We believe integrity is the heartbeat of ExamSoft. It shapes our products, the way we treat each other, and how we work with our customers and vendors.

  • Action & Ownership - We have a bias toward action and empower teammates to make decisions.

  • One Team - We strive to break down silos, collaborate effectively, and celebrate each other’s successes.

  • Global Mindset - We respect local cultures and embrace diversity. We think globally and act locally to maximize our impact on education.

Turnitin, LLC is committed to the policy that all persons have equal access to its programs, facilities and employment. We strongly encourage applications from people of color, persons with disabilities, women, and the LGBTQ+ community, regardless of age, gender, religion, marital or veterans status.

title: Chief of Staff
description:

At The Wanderlust Group, you'll be an integral part of a small team, able to make an immediate impact and work alongside some of the most talented and dynamic people anywhere. We believe that a great culture enables great teams to do incredible things.

This is a high-impact role built for someone who likes having their hands in the full end-to-end strategy for an audience. In this role you'll run the acquisition, sales enablement and customer marketing strategies for our audience of Marinas - expanding into campgrounds over the coming years. You'll manage a team of 3-4 to start, and oversee the career development of each member. 

In this role you and your team will:

  • Run targeted B2B campaigns for strategic accounts
  • Deepen our inbound marketing funnel, using SEO and new content to attract leads.
  • Use data to optimize conversion paths and drive free tier users and demo requests.
  • Oversee our B2B events and partnerships strategies. 
  • Support our sales team with collateral and narratives where needed.

  • Use data to develop and deploy upgrade strategies at the right time for our customers.

We think the best candidates will have a mix of the following skills and traits.  However, do not be ruled by the bullet points - if you are lacking on experience in one of these areas but still feel like a strong fit for the role, don't hesitate to apply:

  •  You have a desire to run end-to-end strategies.  We have a ton of respect for specialists, but this role needs someone who is versatile and can see the big picture.
  •  You have experience driving demand.  Whether it was for a product launch or a monthly MQL goal, we need someone who has a track record of bringing in leads.  Experience with account-based marketing or targeted campaigns as well as inbound demand gen is ideal.
  • You are a thoughtful manager.  You have experience managing or leading teams and have examples of how you've helped those who you work with grow and progress in their careers. 
  • You have experience with small business owners. Many of the marinas we work with are family run businesses. Whether you've marketed to them before or you know small business owners yourself, it helps to have an appreciation for what they need and go through.
  •  You admire your peers in sales and customer success.  This role only works if you've got an appreciation for the work those teams do and the challenges they face.
  • You have experience using HubSpot, Salesforce, Google Analytics, Intercom.  These are the tools you'll use most heavily in this role so prior experience would be ideal.
  • You are comfortable setting goals, interpreting data, and reporting on your impact.

Working at Wanderlust
The Wanderlust Group is a unique company.  A hybrid B2B and B2C business, we connect boaters to marinas and campers to campgrounds.  Because we believe in the value of putting screens down and  getting outside, the entire company practices offline Mondays.  Spend your Mondays hiking, thinking, reading, sailing. It doesn't matter as long as you're not emailing or in meetings. We also care a lot about the marinas and campgrounds we serve.  They are often small businesses playing an important role in the local economy around them.  That dedication carries through our work. Finally, because we are wanderers at heart, this position is open to remote candidates.

title: Content Marketing Manager
description:
Who we are

At Personify, we build strong connections with our clients so they can build strong connections with their communities. One of the most diversified and fastest-growing technology providers of integrated software solutions, we are innovative leaders in the industry and respond to the needs of our clients through products that include:

  • A2Z Events, a multi-event platform that enables clients to manage their events from start to finish, including floor plans, financials, managing contracts and sponsorships, and increasing engagement through mobile applications and a networking suite.
  • CommUnity, an online community platform for those with common interests to connect, learn and collaborate.
  • Wild Apricot, an all-in-one solution that automates and simplifies workflows enabling nonprofits and associations to manage their membership, streamline their processes, and make room for human connections.
  • Member Clicks, an easy-to-use member management cloud solution aimed at small to medium-sized nonprofit organizations and associations.
  • ThreeSixty, an enterprise management solution for associations, nonprofits, YMCAs and JCCs to engage, manage and grow their membership.
  • And more.

At Personify, we're in the relationship building business, powering conversations, donations, events, and foundations through analytics, tools, and robust backend management systems. With 300+ employees in our offices in Austin, Atlanta, and Toronto, and as part of remote teams across Canada and the US, we're the people designing the technology that reaches 30,000+ clients resulting in 3B+ interactions a year with our products. Joining us is a chance to take your skills and expertise and build solutions for the real world that strengthen the connection between clients, their mission and their communities.

 

Who we need

We're looking for a Content Marketing Manager to join our SaaS inbound marketing team and grow our content acquisition machine. Under our Senior Content Marketing Manager, you will own the content for MemberClicks as a part of our Small-Medium Business (SMB) unit.

SEO is a crucial driver for our segment, and you're going to be instrumental in making MemberClicks an industry-leading brand publisher in our space. You will work across the marketing funnel, write to the needs of our audience (Nonprofits, trade associations, Chambers of Commerce, etc.), and have a direct impact on business results. You will blend your fine-tuned analytical skills with your creative mind by developing content that appeals to Google's algorithm, supports the buying journey, and helps our audience increase the impact of their mission-driven organizations.

Who you are

You're a wordsmith by trade and are always looking for ways to improve your writing, editorial, and proofreading (hey, grammar nerds!) skills. But you go beyond being a Creative: you bring an understanding of B2B strategy, full-funnel marketing, and content optimization. You care about how your content impacts business results and are motivated to take ownership of reporting on what is or isn't working.

If you've been involved in the nonprofit sector as a volunteer, staff member, marketer, board member, or otherwise, make sure you highlight this experience: already understanding our audience could give you a leg up in the application process!

What's in it for you

  • Influence and balance. MemberClicks is a recent acquisition, with an exciting opportunity to be a part of a transformative SEO project. You will own a massive library of content to build a strategy. You will be the owner and the driver of the voice and messaging, reaching an audience of small-to-mid-sized associations, chambers and nonprofits seeking solutions. This is a chance to use content to create real business results.
  • In-demand skills growth. You'll get to partner with a technical SEO Consultant, immediately growing your understanding of how to optimize content. You will learn what parts of a website or web page do and don't affect SEO (diving into page speed, mobile responsiveness, data structure, etc.) as well as SEO for video content. 
  • An impactful multifaceted role. You will be part of a robust content programme, contributing as a content strategist, writer, editor, and project manager. You'll have access to a team of freelancers and a content agency to make your magic happen, and you'll have access to the data you need to see the tangible results of your work.
  • Career development. You will report to a manager who prides themselves on supporting their team's career progression and skills development. They will guide and coach you towards increased independence and autonomy in your role. You will build the expertise and exposure to move up to a Senior Marketing Manager, Content Strategist, or SEO Consultant here or elsewhere. Or move into another vertical at Personify, further broadening your skills.
  • Collaboration, both casual and corporate. At Personify, we offer a balance between established and responsive, between new and tenured. We are proud to say many of our team members have been here for 5, 10, even 15 years, alongside the teammates who've joined us recently. While this is a fully remote role, the option to join us in our casual, energetic Toronto office is open (when you feel comfortable doing so). You will be part of an incredible Content Marketing team working together to create content that really matters to our audience.

How you will make an impact:

  • Grow your knowledge. You will dive into learning about our customers: nonprofits, associations, clubs, and membership organizations. You will explore their web-based groups, newsletters, etc., understand how to position our solutions and comprehend how they are already - or could be - engaging us. You will develop and launch a quarterly webinar series featuring key industry leaders in the association space.
  • Produce whip-smart content. You will outline, assign, edit, and publish blog content that drives traffic to our site and provides real value to our audience. You will plan and write high-value gated content (ebooks, guides, checklists, etc.), resulting in a high conversion rate. To help you get great work done on time, you will oversee and guide 2-4 freelancers and work with our content agency to create strategic guest posts that build our backlink profile.
  • Collaborate to drive results. You will work with our Senior Content Marketing Manager and our SEO Consultant to create content within a portfolio SEO strategy that promotes MemberClicks to our target prospects—without cannibalizing the target markets of Personify's other brands. You will gain and apply new insights and approaches to optimizing content.
  • Apply full-funnel thinking to the content you create. You will build out your understanding of how thought leadership and nurture content come together to position our solutions as the answer to target markets' pain points. You will continuously seek out best practices for lead generation through content marketing.

What you bring:

  • The education and experience. You have 2+ years of experience in a B2B Content Marketing or SEO role, preferably for a SaaS company or agency. Exposure to the SMB segment is a plus. A portfolio demonstrating your ability to capture attention and drive engagement is essential.
  • The creativity and the analytics. You have substantial experience writing, editing, proofreading, and publishing content and an understanding of organic SEO, inbound marketing, full-funnel marketing, and content journeys. You've created valuable gated assets (ebooks, guides, checklists, etc.) that result in high landing page conversion rates and capture high-quality prospects for nurture. 
  • The technical skills. You know how to rank on Google for a chosen keyword and have results you can share with us. You may have some experience with HubSpot or other marketing automation platforms. 
  • The philosophy. You're self-driven with a desire to experiment, fail, learn, and grow. You're a team player who knows collaboration is the key to any organization's success.
  • The communication and interpersonal skills. Your writing is exceptional, and you have equally strong oral and presentation skills. You can easily build a positive, professional relationship with stakeholders at any level, comfortably working across teams.

Why join us?

We are committed to creating a balanced, inclusive, and equitable workplace.

  • We recognize and appreciate the varied experiences, backgrounds, and knowledge our team can bring to our culture, operations, products, and relationships internally and externally.
  • We have an impactful recruitment diversity strategy to increase representation across the company at every level. And, we're working with our teams to create employee resource groups that further support our people in the safe spaces and ways they need to feel heard.

We're proud of our evolution. We promote -and live- a culture of not just listening but acting, making ourselves available and accessible.

We're a great place to work.

Guided by our values, inspired by our clients, and forging ahead with optimism and the commitment to service of a new President and CEO, Scott Collison, at the helm, Personify is driven by our purpose. We empower our clients, from small nonprofits to large enterprise organizations, to build strong connections with their communities, ultimately enabling them to achieve their missions. And, our leadership team brings profound expertise and a deep commitment to taking Personify to the next level.

With generous paid-time-off, flexibility, and the option to be fully remote, we prioritize the well being of our teams. Choosing where to power up their laptops empowers our employees to connect with each other and our clients from anywhere while meeting their life demands and without sacrificing their performance. In fact, we know it makes them do better, feel better, and enjoy being part of our company.

Recognized by Built In Austin in its Best Places to Work Awards in both 2019 and 2020, we spend our days creating a virtual place and physical space where people are comfortable being themselves, feel supported and heard, enjoy each other's company, and have an opportunity to shine.

Apply now.

Personify is a company made up of people who like to work with brilliant teams passionate about delivering exceptional solutions to our clients. We're a place to make an impact, see the difference, and accelerate your career doing something you love.

We know not everyone gains their education and skills the traditional way, so if you feel you have 70% of the qualifications you are looking for and you are ready to make a difference, submit your application. Of course, we can't promise it will be a fit, but we do promise to consider the full scope of who you are and what you bring.

Personify is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, veteran or disability status, or other protected characteristics.

Employment offers are contingent on the candidate successfully completing a background investigation in compliance with federal, provincial and local laws.
